2235     Array.prototype.map = function(fn, context) {
2236       var result = [ ];
2237       for (var i = 0, len = this.length >>> 0; i < len; i++) {
2238         if (i in this) {
2239           result[i] = fn.call(context, this[i], i, this);
2240         }
2241       }
2242       return result;
2243     };
2244   }
2245 
2246   if (!Array.prototype.every) {
2247     /**
2248      * Returns true if a callback returns truthy value for all elements in an array
2249      * @method every
2250      * @param {Function} fn Callback to invoke for each element
2251      * @param {Object} [context] Context to invoke callback in
2252      */
2253     Array.prototype.every = function(fn, context) {
2254       for (var i = 0, len = this.length >>> 0; i < len; i++) {
2255         if (i in this && !fn.call(context, this[i], i, this)) {
2256           return false;
2257         }
2258       }
2259       return true;
2260     };
2261   }
2262 
2263   if (!Array.prototype.some) {
2264     /**
2265      * Returns true if a callback returns truthy value for at least one element in an array
2266      * @method every
2267      * @param {Function} fn Callback to invoke for each element
2268      * @param {Object} [context] Context to invoke callback in
2269      */
2270     Array.prototype.some = function(fn, context) {
2271       for (var i = 0, len = this.length >>> 0; i < len; i++) {
2272         if (i in this && fn.call(context, this[i], i, this)) {
2273           return true;
2274         }
2275       }
2276       return false;
2277     };
2278   }
2279 
2280   if (!Array.prototype.filter) {
2281     /**
2282      * Returns the result of iterating over elements in an array
2283      * @method filter
2284      * @param {Function} fn Callback to invoke for each element
2285      * @param {Object} [context] Context to invoke callback in
2286      */
2287     Array.prototype.filter = function(fn, context) {
2288       var result = [ ], val;
2289       for (var i = 0, len = this.length >>> 0; i < len; i++) {
2290         if (i in this) {
2291           val = this[i]; // in case fn mutates this
2292           if (fn.call(context, val, i, this)) {
2293             result.push(val);
2294           }
2295         }
2296       }
2297       return result;
2298     };
2299   }
2300 
2301   if (!Array.prototype.reduce) {
2302     /**
2303      * Returns "folded" (reduced) result of iterating over elements in an array
2304      * @method filter
2305      * @param {Function} fn Callback to invoke for each element
2306      * @param {Object} [context] Context to invoke callback in
2307      */
2308     Array.prototype.reduce = function(fn /*, initial*/) {
2309       var len = this.length >>> 0,
2310           i = 0,
2311           rv;
2312 
2313       if (arguments.length > 1) {
2314         rv = arguments[1];
2315       }
2316       else {
2317         do {
2318           if (i in this) {
2319             rv = this[i++];
2320             break;
2321           }
2322           // if array contains no values, no initial value to return
2323           if (++i >= len) {
2324             throw new TypeError();
2325           }
2326         }
2327         while (true);
2328       }
2329       for (; i < len; i++) {
2330         if (i in this) {
2331           rv = fn.call(null, rv, this[i], i, this);
2332         }
2333       }
2334       return rv;
2335     };
2336   }
2337 
2338   /**
2339    * Invokes method on all items in a given array
2340    * @method invoke
2341    * @memberOf fabric.util.array
2342    * @param {Array} array Array to iterate over
2343    * @param {String} method Name of a method to invoke
2344    */
2345   function invoke(array, method) {
2346     var args = slice.call(arguments, 2), result = [ ];
2347     for (var i = 0, len = array.length; i < len; i++) {
2348       result[i] = args.length ? array[i][method].apply(array[i], args) : array[i][method].call(array[i]);
2349     }
2350     return result;
2351   }
2352 
2353   /**
2354    * Finds maximum value in array (not necessarily "first" one)
2355    * @method max
2356    * @memberOf fabric.util.array
2357    * @param {Array} array Array to iterate over
2358    * @param {String} byProperty
2359    */
2360   function max(array, byProperty) {
2361     if (!array || array.length === 0) return undefined;
2362 
2363     var i = array.length - 1,
2364         result = byProperty ? array[i][byProperty] : array[i];
2365     if (byProperty) {
2366       while (i--) {
2367         if (array[i][byProperty] >= result) {
2368           result = array[i][byProperty];
2369         }
2370       }
2371     }
2372     else {
2373       while (i--) {
2374         if (array[i] >= result) {
2375           result = array[i];
2376         }
2377       }
2378     }
2379     return result;
2380   }
2381 
2382   /**
2383    * Finds minimum value in array (not necessarily "first" one)
2384    * @method min
2385    * @memberOf fabric.util.array
2386    * @param {Array} array Array to iterate over
2387    * @param {String} byProperty
2388    */
2389   function min(array, byProperty) {
2390     if (!array || array.length === 0) return undefined;
2391 
2392     var i = array.length - 1,
2393         result = byProperty ? array[i][byProperty] : array[i];
2394 
2395     if (byProperty) {
2396       while (i--) {
2397         if (array[i][byProperty] < result) {
2398           result = array[i][byProperty];
2399         }
2400       }
2401     }
2402     else {
2403       while (i--) {
2404         if (array[i] < result) {
2405           result = array[i];
2406         }
2407       }
2408     }
2409     return result;
2410   }
2411 
2412   /** @namespace */
2413   fabric.util.array = {
2414     invoke: invoke,
2415     min: min,
2416     max: max
2417   };
2418 
2419 })();
2420 (function(){
2421   
2422   /**
2423    * Copies all enumerable properties of one object to another
2424    * @memberOf fabric.util.object
2425    * @method extend
2426    * @param {Object} destination Where to copy to
2427    * @param {Object} source Where to copy from
2428    */
2429   function extend(destination, source) {
2430     // JScript DontEnum bug is not taken care of
2431     for (var property in source) {
2432       destination[property] = source[property];
2433     }
2434     return destination;
2435   }
2436 
2437   /**
2438    * Creates an empty object and copies all enumerable properties of another object to it
2439    * @method clone
2440    * @memberOf fabric.util.object
2441    * @param {Object} object Object to clone
2442    */
2443   function clone(object) {
2444     return extend({ }, object);
2445   }
2446 
2447   /** @namespace fabric.util.object */
2448   fabric.util.object = {
2449     extend: extend,
2450     clone: clone
2451   };
2452   
2453 })();
2454 (function() {
2455 
2456 if (!String.prototype.trim) {
2457   /**
2458    * Trims a string (removing whitespace from the beginning and the end)
2459    * @method trim
2460    * @see <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String/Trim">String#trim on MDN</a>
2461    */
2462   String.prototype.trim = function () {
2463     // this trim is not fully ES3 or ES5 compliant, but it should cover most cases for now
2464     return this.replace(/^[\s\xA0]+/, '').replace(/[\s\xA0]+$/, '');
2465   };
2466 }
2467 
2468 /**
2469  * Camelizes a string
2470  * @memberOf fabric.util.string
2471  * @method camelize
2472  * @param {String} string String to camelize
2473  * @return {String} Camelized version of a string
2474  */
2475 function camelize(string) {
2476   return string.replace(/-+(.)?/g, function(match, character) {
2477     return character ? character.toUpperCase() : '';
2478   });
2479 }
2480 
2481 /**
2482  * Capitalizes a string
2483  * @memberOf fabric.util.string
2484  * @method capitalize
2485  * @param {String} string String to capitalize
2486  * @return {String} Capitalized version of a string
2487  */
2488 function capitalize(string) {
2489   return string.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + string.slice(1).toLowerCase();
2490 }
2491 
2492 /**
2493  * Escapes XML in a string
2494  * @memberOf fabric.util.string
2495  * @method escapeXml
2496  * @param {String} string String to escape
2497  * @return {String} Escaped version of a string
2498  */
2499 function escapeXml(string) {
2500   return string.replace(/&/g, '&')
2501      .replace(/"/g, '"')
2502      .replace(/'/g, ''')
2503      .replace(/</g, '<')
2504      .replace(/>/g, '>');
2505 }
2506 
2507 /** @namespace */
2508 fabric.util.string = {
2509   camelize: camelize,
2510   capitalize: capitalize,
2511   escapeXml: escapeXml
2512 };
2513 }());
2514 
2515 (function() {
2516 
2517   var slice = Array.prototype.slice,
2518       apply = Function.prototype.apply,
2519       Dummy = function() { };
2520 
2521   if (!Function.prototype.bind) {
2522     /**
2523      * Cross-browser approximation of ES5 Function.prototype.bind (not fully spec conforming)
2524      * @see <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Function/bind">Function#bind on MDN</a>
2525      * @param {Object} thisArg Object to bind function to
2526      * @param {Any[]} [...] Values to pass to a bound function
2527      * @return {Function}
2528      */
2529     Function.prototype.bind = function(thisArg) {
2530       var fn = this, args = slice.call(arguments, 1), bound;
2531       if (args.length) {
2532         bound = function() {
2533           return apply.call(fn, this instanceof Dummy ? this : thisArg, args.concat(slice.call(arguments)));
2534         };
2535       }
2536       else {
2537         /** @ignore */
2538         bound = function() {
2539           return apply.call(fn, this instanceof Dummy ? this : thisArg, arguments);
2540         };
2541       }
2542       Dummy.prototype = this.prototype;
2543       bound.prototype = new Dummy();
2544 
2545       return bound;
2546     };
2547   }
2548 
2549 })();
2550 (function() {
2551 
2552   var slice = Array.prototype.slice, emptyFunction = function() { };
2553 
2554   var IS_DONTENUM_BUGGY = (function(){
2555     for (var p in { toString: 1 }) {
2556       if (p === 'toString') return false;
2557     }
2558     return true;
2559   })();
2560 
2561   /** @ignore */
2562   var addMethods = function(klass, source, parent) {
2563     for (var property in source) {
2564 
2565       if (property in klass.prototype && typeof klass.prototype[property] === 'function') {
2566 
2567         klass.prototype[property] = (function(property) {
2568           return function() {
2569 
2570             var superclass = this.constructor.superclass;
2571             this.constructor.superclass = parent;
2572             var returnValue = source[property].apply(this, arguments);
2573             this.constructor.superclass = superclass;
2574 
2575             if (property !== 'initialize') {
2576               return returnValue;
2577             }
2578           };
2579         })(property);
2580       }
2581       else {
2582         klass.prototype[property] = source[property];
2583       }
2584 
2585       if (IS_DONTENUM_BUGGY) {
2586         if (source.toString !== Object.prototype.toString) {
2587           klass.prototype.toString = source.toString;
2588         }
2589         if (source.valueOf !== Object.prototype.valueOf) {
2590           klass.prototype.valueOf = source.valueOf;
2591         }
2592       }
2593     }
2594   };
2595 
2596   function Subclass() { }
2597 
2598   function callSuper(methodName) {
2599     var fn = this.constructor.superclass.prototype[methodName];
2600     return (arguments.length > 1)
2601       ? fn.apply(this, slice.call(arguments, 1))
2602       : fn.call(this);
2603   }
2604 
2605   /**
2606    * Helper for creation of "classes". Note that pr
2607    * @method createClass
2608    * @param parent optional "Class" to inherit from
2609    * @param properties Properties shared by all instances of this class
2610    *                  (be careful modifying objects defined here as this would affect all instances)
2611    * @memberOf fabric.util
2612    */
2613   function createClass() {
2614     var parent = null,
2615         properties = slice.call(arguments, 0);
2616 
2617     if (typeof properties[0] === 'function') {
2618       parent = properties.shift();
2619     }
2620     function klass() {
2621       this.initialize.apply(this, arguments);
2622     }
2623 
2624     klass.superclass = parent;
2625     klass.subclasses = [ ];
2626 
2627     if (parent) {
2628       Subclass.prototype = parent.prototype;
2629       klass.prototype = new Subclass();
2630       parent.subclasses.push(klass);
2631     }
2632     for (var i = 0, length = properties.length; i < length; i++) {
2633       addMethods(klass, properties[i], parent);
2634     }
2635     if (!klass.prototype.initialize) {
2636       klass.prototype.initialize = emptyFunction;
2637     }
2638     klass.prototype.constructor = klass;
2639     klass.prototype.callSuper = callSuper;
2640     return klass;
2641   }
2642 
2643   fabric.util.createClass = createClass;
2644 })();
2645 (function () {
2646 
2647   /* EVENT HANDLING */
2648 
2649   function areHostMethods(object) {
2650     var methodNames = Array.prototype.slice.call(arguments, 1),
2651         t, i, len = methodNames.length;
2652     for (i = 0; i < len; i++) {
2653       t = typeof object[methodNames[i]];
2654       if (!(/^(?:function|object|unknown)$/).test(t)) return false;
2655     }
2656     return true;
2657   }
2658   var getUniqueId = (function () {
2659     var uid = 0;
2660     return function (element) {
2661       return element.__uniqueID || (element.__uniqueID = 'uniqueID__' + uid++);
2662     };
2663   })();
2664 
2665   /** @ignore */
2666   var getElement, setElement;
2667 
2668   (function () {
2669     var elements = { };
2670     /** @ignore */
2671     getElement = function (uid) {
2672       return elements[uid];
2673     };
2674     /** @ignore */
2675     setElement = function (uid, element) {
2676       elements[uid] = element;
2677     };
2678   })();
2679 
2680   function createListener(uid, handler) {
2681     return {
2682       handler: handler,
2683       wrappedHandler: createWrappedHandler(uid, handler)
2684     };
2685   }
2686 
2687   function createWrappedHandler(uid, handler) {
2688     return function (e) {
2689       handler.call(getElement(uid), e || fabric.window.event);
2690     };
2691   }
2692 
2693   function createDispatcher(uid, eventName) {
2694     return function (e) {
2695       if (handlers[uid] && handlers[uid][eventName]) {
2696         var handlersForEvent = handlers[uid][eventName];
2697         for (var i = 0, len = handlersForEvent.length; i < len; i++) {
2698           handlersForEvent[i].call(this, e || fabric.window.event);
2699         }
2700       }
2701     };
2702   }
2703 
2704   var shouldUseAddListenerRemoveListener = (
2705         areHostMethods(fabric.document.documentElement, 'addEventListener', 'removeEventListener') &&
2706         areHostMethods(fabric.window, 'addEventListener', 'removeEventListener')),
2707 
2708       shouldUseAttachEventDetachEvent = (
2709         areHostMethods(fabric.document.documentElement, 'attachEvent', 'detachEvent') &&
2710         areHostMethods(fabric.window, 'attachEvent', 'detachEvent')),
2711 
2712       // IE branch
2713       listeners = { },
2714 
2715       // DOM L0 branch
2716       handlers = { },
2717 
2718       addListener, removeListener;
2719 
2720   if (shouldUseAddListenerRemoveListener) {
2721     /** @ignore */
2722     addListener = function (element, eventName, handler) {
2723       element.addEventListener(eventName, handler, false);
2724     };
2725     /** @ignore */
2726     removeListener = function (element, eventName, handler) {
2727       element.removeEventListener(eventName, handler, false);
2728     };
2729   }
2730 
2731   else if (shouldUseAttachEventDetachEvent) {
2732     /** @ignore */
2733     addListener = function (element, eventName, handler) {
2734       var uid = getUniqueId(element);
2735       setElement(uid, element);
2736       if (!listeners[uid]) {
2737         listeners[uid] = { };
2738       }
2739       if (!listeners[uid][eventName]) {
2740         listeners[uid][eventName] = [ ];
2741 
2742       }
2743       var listener = createListener(uid, handler);
2744       listeners[uid][eventName].push(listener);
2745       element.attachEvent('on' + eventName, listener.wrappedHandler);
2746     };
2747     /** @ignore */
2748     removeListener = function (element, eventName, handler) {
2749       var uid = getUniqueId(element), listener;
2750       if (listeners[uid] && listeners[uid][eventName]) {
2751         for (var i = 0, len = listeners[uid][eventName].length; i < len; i++) {
2752           listener = listeners[uid][eventName][i];
2753           if (listener && listener.handler === handler) {
2754             element.detachEvent('on' + eventName, listener.wrappedHandler);
2755             listeners[uid][eventName][i] = null;
2756           }
2757         }
2758       }
2759     };
2760   }
2761   else {
2762     /** @ignore */
2763     addListener = function (element, eventName, handler) {
2764       var uid = getUniqueId(element);
2765       if (!handlers[uid]) {
2766         handlers[uid] = { };
2767       }
2768       if (!handlers[uid][eventName]) {
2769         handlers[uid][eventName] = [ ];
2770         var existingHandler = element['on' + eventName];
2771         if (existingHandler) {
2772           handlers[uid][eventName].push(existingHandler);
2773         }
2774         element['on' + eventName] = createDispatcher(uid, eventName);
2775       }
2776       handlers[uid][eventName].push(handler);
2777     };
2778     /** @ignore */
2779     removeListener = function (element, eventName, handler) {
2780       var uid = getUniqueId(element);
2781       if (handlers[uid] && handlers[uid][eventName]) {
2782         var handlersForEvent = handlers[uid][eventName];
2783         for (var i = 0, len = handlersForEvent.length; i < len; i++) {
2784           if (handlersForEvent[i] === handler) {
2785             handlersForEvent.splice(i, 1);
2786           }
2787         }
2788       }
2789     };
2790   }
2791 
2792   /**
2793    * Adds an event listener to an element
2794    * @mthod addListener
2795    * @memberOf fabric.util
2796    * @function
2797    * @param {HTMLElement} element
2798    * @param {String} eventName
2799    * @param {Function} handler
2800    */
2801   fabric.util.addListener = addListener;
2802 
2803   /**
2804    * Removes an event listener from an element
2805    * @mthod removeListener
2806    * @memberOf fabric.util
2807    * @function
2808    * @param {HTMLElement} element
2809    * @param {String} eventName
2810    * @param {Function} handler
2811    */
2812   fabric.util.removeListener = removeListener;
2813 
2814   /**
2815    * Cross-browser wrapper for getting event's coordinates
2816    * @method getPointer
2817    * @memberOf fabric.util
2818    * @param {Event} event
2819    */
2820   function getPointer(event) {
2821     event || (event = fabric.window.event);
2822 
2823     var element = event.target || event.srcElement,
2824         scrollLeft = 0,
2825         scrollTop = 0,
2826         firstFixedAncestor;
2827 
2828     while (element && element.parentNode && !firstFixedAncestor) {
2829         element = element.parentNode;
2830 
2831         if (element !== fabric.document && fabric.util.getElementPosition(element) === 'fixed') firstFixedAncestor = element;
2832 
2833         scrollLeft += element.scrollLeft || 0;
2834         scrollTop += element.scrollTop || 0;
2835     }
2836 
2837     return {
2838         x: pointerX(event) + scrollLeft,
2839         y: pointerY(event) + scrollTop
2840     };
2841   }
2842 
2843   var pointerX = function(event) {
2844     // looks like in IE (<9) clientX at certain point (apparently when mouseup fires on VML element)
2845     // is represented as COM object, with all the consequences, like "unknown" type and error on [[Get]]
2846     // need to investigate later
2847     return (typeof event.clientX !== 'unknown' ? event.clientX : 0);
2848   };
2849 
2850   var pointerY = function(event) {
2851     return (typeof event.clientY !== 'unknown' ? event.clientY : 0);
2852   };
2853 
2854   if (fabric.isTouchSupported) {
2855     pointerX = function(event) {
2856       return event.touches && event.touches[0] && event.touches[0].pageX || event.clientX;
2857     };
2858     pointerY = function(event) {
2859       return event.touches && event.touches[0] && event.touches[0].pageY || event.clientY;
2860     };
2861   }
2862 
2863   fabric.util.getPointer = getPointer;
2864 
2865   fabric.util.object.extend(fabric.util, fabric.Observable);
2866 
2867 })();
2868 (function () {
2869 
2870   /**
2871    * Cross-browser wrapper for setting element's style
2872    * @method setStyle
2873    * @memberOf fabric.util
2874    * @param {HTMLElement} element
2875    * @param {Object} styles
2876    * @return {HTMLElement} Element that was passed as a first argument
2877    */
2878   function setStyle(element, styles) {
2879     var elementStyle = element.style;
2880     if (!elementStyle) {
2881       return element;
2882     }
2883     if (typeof styles === 'string') {
2884       element.style.cssText += ';' + styles;
2885       return styles.indexOf('opacity') > -1
2886         ? setOpacity(element, styles.match(/opacity:\s*(\d?\.?\d*)/)[1])
2887         : element;
2888     }
2889     for (var property in styles) {
2890       if (property === 'opacity') {
2891         setOpacity(element, styles[property]);
2892       }
2893       else {
2894         var normalizedProperty = (property === 'float' || property === 'cssFloat')
2895           ? (typeof elementStyle.styleFloat === 'undefined' ? 'cssFloat' : 'styleFloat')
2896           : property;
2897         elementStyle[normalizedProperty] = styles[property];
2898       }
2899     }
2900     return element;
2901   }
2902 
2903   var parseEl = fabric.document.createElement('div'),
2904       supportsOpacity = typeof parseEl.style.opacity === 'string',
2905       supportsFilters = typeof parseEl.style.filter === 'string',
2906       reOpacity = /alpha\s*\(\s*opacity\s*=\s*([^\)]+)\)/,
2907 
2908       /** @ignore */
2909       setOpacity = function (element) { return element; };
2910 
2911   if (supportsOpacity) {
2912     /** @ignore */
2913     setOpacity = function(element, value) {
2914       element.style.opacity = value;
2915       return element;
2916     };
2917   }
2918   else if (supportsFilters) {
2919     /** @ignore */
2920     setOpacity = function(element, value) {
2921       var es = element.style;
2922       if (element.currentStyle && !element.currentStyle.hasLayout) {
2923         es.zoom = 1;
2924       }
2925       if (reOpacity.test(es.filter)) {
2926         value = value >= 0.9999 ? '' : ('alpha(opacity=' + (value * 100) + ')');
2927         es.filter = es.filter.replace(reOpacity, value);
2928       }
2929       else {
2930         es.filter += ' alpha(opacity=' + (value * 100) + ')';
2931       }
2932       return element;
2933     };
2934   }
2935 
2936   fabric.util.setStyle = setStyle;
2937 
2938 })();
2939 (function() {
2940 
2941   var _slice = Array.prototype.slice;
2942 
2943   /**
2944    * Takes id and returns an element with that id (if one exists in a document)
2945    * @method getById
2946    * @memberOf fabric.util
2947    * @param {String|HTMLElement} id
2948    * @return {HTMLElement|null}
2949    */
2950   function getById(id) {
2951     return typeof id === 'string' ? fabric.document.getElementById(id) : id;
2952   }
2953 
2954   /**
2955    * Converts an array-like object (e.g. arguments or NodeList) to an array
2956    * @method toArray
2957    * @memberOf fabric.util
2958    * @param {Object} arrayLike
2959    * @return {Array}
2960    */
2961   var toArray = function(arrayLike) {
2962     return _slice.call(arrayLike, 0);
2963   };
2964 
2965   var sliceCanConvertNodelists;
2966   try {
2967     sliceCanConvertNodelists = toArray(fabric.document.childNodes) instanceof Array;
2968   }
2969   catch(err) { }
2970 
2971   if (!sliceCanConvertNodelists) {
2972     toArray = function(arrayLike) {
2973       var arr = new Array(arrayLike.length), i = arrayLike.length;
2974       while (i--) {
2975         arr[i] = arrayLike[i];
2976       }
2977       return arr;
2978     };
2979   }
2980 
2981   /**
2982    * Creates specified element with specified attributes
2983    * @method makeElement
2984    * @memberOf fabric.util
2985    * @param {String} tagName Type of an element to create
2986    * @param {Object} [attributes] Attributes to set on an element
2987    * @return {HTMLElement} Newly created element
2988    */
2989   function makeElement(tagName, attributes) {
2990     var el = fabric.document.createElement(tagName);
2991     for (var prop in attributes) {
2992       if (prop === 'class') {
2993         el.className = attributes[prop];
2994       }
2995       else if (prop === 'for') {
2996         el.htmlFor = attributes[prop];
2997       }
2998       else {
2999         el.setAttribute(prop, attributes[prop]);
3000       }
3001     }
3002     return el;
3003   }
3004 
3005   /**
3006    * Adds class to an element
3007    * @method addClass
3008    * @memberOf fabric.util
3009    * @param {HTMLElement} element Element to add class to
3010    * @param {String} className Class to add to an element
3011    */
3012   function addClass(element, className) {
3013     if ((' ' + element.className + ' ').indexOf(' ' + className + ' ') === -1) {
3014       element.className += (element.className ? ' ' : '') + className;
3015     }
3016   }
3017 
3018   /**
3019    * Wraps element with another element
3020    * @method wrapElement
3021    * @memberOf fabric.util
3022    * @param {HTMLElement} element Element to wrap
3023    * @param {HTMLElement|String} wrapper Element to wrap with
3024    * @param {Object} [attributes] Attributes to set on a wrapper
3025    * @return {HTMLElement} wrapper
3026    */
3027   function wrapElement(element, wrapper, attributes) {
3028     if (typeof wrapper === 'string') {
3029       wrapper = makeElement(wrapper, attributes);
3030     }
3031     if (element.parentNode) {
3032       element.parentNode.replaceChild(wrapper, element);
3033     }
3034     wrapper.appendChild(element);
3035     return wrapper;
3036   }
3037 
3038   /**
3039    * Returns offset for a given element
3040    * @method getElementOffset
3041    * @function
3042    * @memberOf fabric.util
3043    * @param {HTMLElement} element Element to get offset for
3044    * @return {Object} Object with "left" and "top" properties
3045    */
3046   function getElementOffset(element) {
3047     // TODO (kangax): need to fix this method
3048     var valueT = 0, valueL = 0;
3049     do {
3050       valueT += element.offsetTop  || 0;
3051       valueL += element.offsetLeft || 0;
3052       element = element.offsetParent;
3053     }
3054     while (element);
3055     return ({ left: valueL, top: valueT });
3056   }
3057 
3058   /**
3059   * Returns position of a given element
3060   * @method getElementPosition
3061   * @function
3062   * @memberOf fabric.util
3063   * @param {HTMLElement} element Element to get offset for
3064   * @return {Object} position of the given element.
3065   */
3066   var getElementPosition;
3067   if (fabric.document.defaultView && fabric.document.defaultView.getComputedStyle) {
3068     getElementPosition = function (element) {
3069       return fabric.document.defaultView.getComputedStyle(element, null).position;
3070     };
3071   }
3072   else {
3073     /** @ignore */
3074     getElementPosition = function (element) {
3075       var value = element.style.position;
3076       if (!value && element.currentStyle) value = element.currentStyle.position;
3077       return value;
3078     };
3079   }
3080 
3081   (function () {
3082     var style = fabric.document.documentElement.style;
3083 
3084     var selectProp = 'userSelect' in style
3085       ? 'userSelect'
3086       : 'MozUserSelect' in style
3087         ? 'MozUserSelect'
3088         : 'WebkitUserSelect' in style
3089           ? 'WebkitUserSelect'
3090           : 'KhtmlUserSelect' in style
3091             ? 'KhtmlUserSelect'
3092             : '';
3093 
3094     /**
3095      * Makes element unselectable
3096      * @method makeElementUnselectable
3097      * @memberOf fabric.util
3098      * @param {HTMLElement} element Element to make unselectable
3099      * @return {HTMLElement} Element that was passed in
3100      */
3101     function makeElementUnselectable(element) {
3102       if (typeof element.onselectstart !== 'undefined') {
3103         element.onselectstart = fabric.util.falseFunction;
3104       }
3105       if (selectProp) {
3106         element.style[selectProp] = 'none';
3107       }
3108       else if (typeof element.unselectable === 'string') {
3109         element.unselectable = 'on';
3110       }
3111       return element;
3112     }
3113 
3114     /**
3115      * Makes element selectable
3116      * @method makeElementSelectable
3117      * @memberOf fabric.util
3118      * @param {HTMLElement} element Element to make selectable
3119      * @return {HTMLElement} Element that was passed in
3120      */
3121     function makeElementSelectable(element) {
3122       if (typeof element.onselectstart !== 'undefined') {
3123         element.onselectstart = null;
3124       }
3125       if (selectProp) {
3126         element.style[selectProp] = '';
3127       }
3128       else if (typeof element.unselectable === 'string') {
3129         element.unselectable = '';
3130       }
3131       return element;
3132     }
3133 
3134     fabric.util.makeElementUnselectable = makeElementUnselectable;
3135     fabric.util.makeElementSelectable = makeElementSelectable;
3136   })();
3137 
3138   (function() {
3139 
3140     /**
3141      * Inserts a script element with a given url into a document; invokes callback, when that script is finished loading
3142      * @method getScript
3143      * @memberOf fabric.util
3144      * @param {String} url URL of a script to load
3145      * @param {Function} callback Callback to execute when script is finished loading
3146      */
3147     function getScript(url, callback) {
3148       var headEl = fabric.document.getElementsByTagName("head")[0],
3149           scriptEl = fabric.document.createElement('script'),
3150           loading = true;
3151 
3152       scriptEl.type = 'text/javascript';
3153       scriptEl.setAttribute('runat', 'server');
3154 
3155       /** @ignore */
3156       scriptEl.onload = /** @ignore */ scriptEl.onreadystatechange = function(e) {
3157         if (loading) {
3158           if (typeof this.readyState === 'string' &&
3159               this.readyState !== 'loaded' &&
3160               this.readyState !== 'complete') return;
3161           loading = false;
3162           callback(e || fabric.window.event);
3163           scriptEl = scriptEl.onload = scriptEl.onreadystatechange = null;
3164         }
3165       };
3166       scriptEl.src = url;
3167       headEl.appendChild(scriptEl);
3168       // causes issue in Opera
3169       // headEl.removeChild(scriptEl);
3170     }
3171 
3172     fabric.util.getScript = getScript;
3173   })();
3174 
3175   fabric.util.getById = getById;
3176   fabric.util.toArray = toArray;
3177   fabric.util.makeElement = makeElement;
3178   fabric.util.addClass = addClass;
3179   fabric.util.wrapElement = wrapElement;
3180   fabric.util.getElementOffset = getElementOffset;
3181   fabric.util.getElementPosition = getElementPosition;
3182 
3183 })();
3184 (function(){
3185 
3186   function addParamToUrl(url, param) {
3187     return url + (/\?/.test(url) ? '&' : '?') + param;
3188   }
3189 
3190   var makeXHR = (function() {
3191     var factories = [
3192       function() { return new ActiveXObject("Microsoft.XMLHTTP"); },
3193       function() { return new ActiveXObject("Msxml2.XMLHTTP"); },
3194       function() { return new ActiveXObject("Msxml2.XMLHTTP.3.0"); },
3195       function() { return new XMLHttpRequest(); }
3196     ];
3197     for (var i = factories.length; i--; ) {
3198       try {
3199         var req = factories[i]();
3200         if (req) {
3201           return factories[i];
3202         }
3203       }
3204       catch (err) { }
3205     }
3206   })();
3207 
3208   function emptyFn() { }
3209 
3210   /**
3211    * Cross-browser abstraction for sending XMLHttpRequest
3212    * @method request
3213    * @memberOf fabric.util
3214    * @param {String} url URL to send XMLHttpRequest to
3215    * @param {Object} [options] Options object
3216    * @param {String} [options.method="GET"]
3217    * @param {Function} options.onComplete Callback to invoke when request is completed
3218    * @return {XMLHttpRequest} request
3219    */
3220   function request(url, options) {
3221 
3222     options || (options = { });
3223 
3224     var method = options.method ? options.method.toUpperCase() : 'GET',
3225         onComplete = options.onComplete || function() { },
3226         xhr = makeXHR(),
3227         body;
3228 
3229     /** @ignore */
3230     xhr.onreadystatechange = function() {
3231       if (xhr.readyState === 4) {
3232         onComplete(xhr);
3233         xhr.onreadystatechange = emptyFn;
3234       }
3235     };
3236 
3237     if (method === 'GET') {
3238       body = null;
3239       if (typeof options.parameters === 'string') {
3240         url = addParamToUrl(url, options.parameters);
3241       }
3242     }
3243 
3244     xhr.open(method, url, true);
3245 
3246     if (method === 'POST' || method === 'PUT') {
3247       xhr.setRequestHeader('Content-Type', 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded');
3248     }
3249 
3250     xhr.send(body);
3251     return xhr;
3252   }
3253 
3254   fabric.util.request = request;
3255 })();
3256 (function() {
3257 
3258   /**
3259    * Quadratic easing in
3260    * @method easeInQuad
3261    * @memberOf fabric.util.ease
3262    */
3263   function easeInQuad(t, b, c, d) {
3264     return c*(t/=d)*t + b;
3265   }
3266 
3267   /**
3268    * Quadratic easing out
3269    * @method easeOutQuad
3270    * @memberOf fabric.util.ease
3271    */
3272   function easeOutQuad(t, b, c, d) {
3273     return -c *(t/=d)*(t-2) + b;
3274   }
3275 
3276   /**
3277    * Quadratic easing in and out
3278    * @method easeInOutQuad
3279    * @memberOf fabric.util.ease
3280    */
3281   function easeInOutQuad(t, b, c, d) {
3282     t /= (d/2);
3283     if (t < 1) return c/2*t*t + b;
3284     return -c/2 * ((--t)*(t-2) - 1) + b;
3285   }
3286 
3287   /**
3288    * Cubic easing in
3289    * @method easeInCubic
3290    * @memberOf fabric.util.ease
3291    */
3292   function easeInCubic(t, b, c, d) {
3293     return c*(t/=d)*t*t + b;
3294   }
3295 
3296   /**
3297    * Cubic easing out
3298    * @method easeOutCubic
3299    * @memberOf fabric.util.ease
3300    */
3301   function easeOutCubic(t, b, c, d) {
3302     return c*((t=t/d-1)*t*t + 1) + b;
3303   }
3304 
3305   /**
3306    * Cubic easing in and out
3307    * @method easeInOutCubic
3308    * @memberOf fabric.util.ease
3309    */
3310   function easeInOutCubic(t, b, c, d) {
3311     t /= d/2;
3312     if (t < 1) return c/2*t*t*t + b;
3313     return c/2*((t-=2)*t*t + 2) + b;
3314   }
3315 
3316   /**
3317    * Quartic easing in
3318    * @method easeInQuart
3319    * @memberOf fabric.util.ease
3320    */
3321   function easeInQuart(t, b, c, d) {
3322     return c*(t/=d)*t*t*t + b;
3323   }
3324 
3325   /**
3326    * Quartic easing out
3327    * @method easeOutQuart
3328    * @memberOf fabric.util.ease
3329    */
3330   function easeOutQuart(t, b, c, d) {
3331     return -c * ((t=t/d-1)*t*t*t - 1) + b;
3332   }
3333 
3334   /**
3335    * Quartic easing in and out
3336    * @method easeInOutQuart
3337    * @memberOf fabric.util.ease
3338    */
3339   function easeInOutQuart(t, b, c, d) {
3340     t /= d/2;
3341     if (t < 1) return c/2*t*t*t*t + b;
3342     return -c/2 * ((t-=2)*t*t*t - 2) + b;
3343   }
3344 
3345   /**
3346    * Quintic easing in
3347    * @method easeInQuint
3348    * @memberOf fabric.util.ease
3349    */
3350   function easeInQuint(t, b, c, d) {
3351     return c*(t/=d)*t*t*t*t + b;
3352   }
3353 
3354   /**
3355    * Quintic easing out
3356    * @method easeOutQuint
3357    * @memberOf fabric.util.ease
3358    */
3359   function easeOutQuint(t, b, c, d) {
3360     return c*((t=t/d-1)*t*t*t*t + 1) + b;
3361   }
3362 
3363   /**
3364    * Quintic easing in and out
3365    * @method easeInOutQuint
3366    * @memberOf fabric.util.ease
3367    */
3368   function easeInOutQuint(t, b, c, d) {
3369     t /= d/2;
3370     if (t < 1) return c/2*t*t*t*t*t + b;
3371     return c/2*((t-=2)*t*t*t*t + 2) + b;
3372   }
3373 
3374   /**
3375    * Sinusoidal easing in
3376    * @method easeInSine
3377    * @memberOf fabric.util.ease
3378    */
3379   function easeInSine(t, b, c, d) {
3380     return -c * Math.cos(t/d * (Math.PI/2)) + c + b;
3381   }
3382 
3383   /**
3384    * Sinusoidal easing out
3385    * @method easeOutSine
3386    * @memberOf fabric.util.ease
3387    */
3388   function easeOutSine(t, b, c, d) {
3389     return c * Math.sin(t/d * (Math.PI/2)) + b;
3390   }
3391 
3392   /**
3393    * Sinusoidal easing in and out
3394    * @method easeInOutSine
3395    * @memberOf fabric.util.ease
3396    */
3397   function easeInOutSine(t, b, c, d) {
3398     return -c/2 * (Math.cos(Math.PI*t/d) - 1) + b;
3399   }
3400 
3401   /**
3402    * Exponential easing in
3403    * @method easeInExpo
3404    * @memberOf fabric.util.ease
3405    */
3406   function easeInExpo(t, b, c, d) {
3407     return (t===0) ? b : c * Math.pow(2, 10 * (t/d - 1)) + b;
3408   }
3409 
3410   /**
3411    * Exponential easing out
3412    * @method easeOutExpo
3413    * @memberOf fabric.util.ease
3414    */
3415   function easeOutExpo(t, b, c, d) {
3416     return (t===d) ? b+c : c * (-Math.pow(2, -10 * t/d) + 1) + b;
3417   }
3418 
3419   /**
3420    * Exponential easing in and out
3421    * @method easeInOutExpo
3422    * @memberOf fabric.util.ease
3423    */
3424   function easeInOutExpo(t, b, c, d) {
3425     if (t===0) return b;
3426     if (t===d) return b+c;
3427     t /= d/2;
3428     if (t < 1) return c/2 * Math.pow(2, 10 * (t - 1)) + b;
3429     return c/2 * (-Math.pow(2, -10 * --t) + 2) + b;
3430   }
3431 
3432   /**
3433    * Circular easing in
3434    * @method easeInCirc
3435    * @memberOf fabric.util.ease
3436    */
3437   function easeInCirc(t, b, c, d) {
3438     return -c * (Math.sqrt(1 - (t/=d)*t) - 1) + b;
3439   }
3440 
3441   /**
3442    * Circular easing out
3443    * @method easeOutCirc
3444    * @memberOf fabric.util.ease
3445    */
3446   function easeOutCirc(t, b, c, d) {
3447     return c * Math.sqrt(1 - (t=t/d-1)*t) + b;
3448   }
3449 
3450   /**
3451    * Circular easing in and out
3452    * @method easeInOutCirc
3453    * @memberOf fabric.util.ease
3454    */
3455   function easeInOutCirc(t, b, c, d) {
3456     t /= d/2;
3457     if (t < 1) return -c/2 * (Math.sqrt(1 - t*t) - 1) + b;
3458     return c/2 * (Math.sqrt(1 - (t-=2)*t) + 1) + b;
3459   }
3460 
3461   /**
3462    * Elastic easing in
3463    * @method easeInElastic
3464    * @memberOf fabric.util.ease
3465    */
3466   function easeInElastic(t, b, c, d) {
3467     var s=1.70158;var p=0;var a=c;
3468     if (t===0) return b;
3469     t /= d;
3470     if (t===1) return b+c;
3471     if (!p) p=d*0.3;
3472     if (a < Math.abs(c)) { a=c; s=p/4; }
3473     else s = p/(2*Math.PI) * Math.asin (c/a);
3474     return -(a*Math.pow(2,10*(t-=1)) * Math.sin( (t*d-s)*(2*Math.PI)/p )) + b;
3475   }
3476 
3477   /**
3478    * Elastic easing out
3479    * @method easeOutElastic
3480    * @memberOf fabric.util.ease
3481    */
3482   function easeOutElastic(t, b, c, d) {
3483     var s=1.70158;var p=0;var a=c;
3484     if (t===0) return b;
3485     t /= d;
3486     if (t===1) return b+c;
3487     if (!p) p=d*0.3;
3488     if (a < Math.abs(c)) { a=c; s=p/4; }
3489     else s = p/(2*Math.PI) * Math.asin (c/a);
3490     return a*Math.pow(2,-10*t) * Math.sin( (t*d-s)*(2*Math.PI)/p ) + c + b;
3491   }
3492 
3493   /**
3494    * Elastic easing in and out
3495    * @method easeInOutElastic
3496    * @memberOf fabric.util.ease
3497    */
3498   function easeInOutElastic(t, b, c, d) {
3499     var s=1.70158;var p=0;var a=c;
3500     if (t===0) return b;
3501     t /= d/2;
3502     if (t===2) return b+c;
3503     if (!p) p=d*(0.3*1.5);
3504     if (a < Math.abs(c)) { a=c; s=p/4; }
3505     else s = p/(2*Math.PI) * Math.asin (c/a);
3506     if (t < 1) return -0.5*(a*Math.pow(2,10*(t-=1)) * Math.sin( (t*d-s)*(2*Math.PI)/p )) + b;
3507     return a*Math.pow(2,-10*(t-=1)) * Math.sin( (t*d-s)*(2*Math.PI)/p )*0.5 + c + b;
3508   }
3509 
3510   /**
3511    * Backwards easing in
3512    * @method easeInBack
3513    * @memberOf fabric.util.ease
3514    */
3515   function easeInBack(t, b, c, d, s) {
3516     if (s === undefined) s = 1.70158;
3517     return c*(t/=d)*t*((s+1)*t - s) + b;
3518   }
3519 
3520   /**
3521    * Backwards easing out
3522    * @method easeOutBack
3523    * @memberOf fabric.util.ease
3524    */
3525   function easeOutBack(t, b, c, d, s) {
3526     if (s === undefined) s = 1.70158;
3527     return c*((t=t/d-1)*t*((s+1)*t + s) + 1) + b;
3528   }
3529 
3530   /**
3531    * Backwards easing in and out
3532    * @method easeInOutBack
3533    * @memberOf fabric.util.ease
3534    */
3535   function easeInOutBack(t, b, c, d, s) {
3536     if (s === undefined) s = 1.70158;
3537     t /= d/2;
3538     if (t < 1) return c/2*(t*t*(((s*=(1.525))+1)*t - s)) + b;
3539     return c/2*((t-=2)*t*(((s*=(1.525))+1)*t + s) + 2) + b;
3540   }
3541 
3542   /**
3543    * Bouncing easing in
3544    * @method easeInBounce
3545    * @memberOf fabric.util.ease
3546    */
3547   function easeInBounce(t, b, c, d) {
3548     return c - easeOutBounce (d-t, 0, c, d) + b;
3549   }
3550 
3551   /**
3552    * Bouncing easing out
3553    * @method easeOutBounce
3554    * @memberOf fabric.util.ease
3555    */
3556   function easeOutBounce(t, b, c, d) {
3557     if ((t/=d) < (1/2.75)) {
3558       return c*(7.5625*t*t) + b;
3559     } else if (t < (2/2.75)) {
3560       return c*(7.5625*(t-=(1.5/2.75))*t + 0.75) + b;
3561     } else if (t < (2.5/2.75)) {
3562       return c*(7.5625*(t-=(2.25/2.75))*t + 0.9375) + b;
3563     } else {
3564       return c*(7.5625*(t-=(2.625/2.75))*t + 0.984375) + b;
3565     }
3566   }
3567 
3568   /**
3569    * Bouncing easing in and out
3570    * @method easeInOutBounce
3571    * @memberOf fabric.util.ease
3572    */
3573   function easeInOutBounce(t, b, c, d) {
3574     if (t < d/2) return easeInBounce (t*2, 0, c, d) * 0.5 + b;
3575     return easeOutBounce (t*2-d, 0, c, d) * 0.5 + c*0.5 + b;
3576   }
3577 
3578   /**
3579    * See <a href="http://gizma.com/easing/">Easing Equations by Robert Penner</a>
3580    * @namespace fabric.util.ease
3581    */
3582   fabric.util.ease = {
3583     easeInQuad: easeInQuad,
3584     easeOutQuad: easeOutQuad,
3585     easeInOutQuad: easeInOutQuad,
3586     easeInCubic: easeInCubic,
3587     easeOutCubic: easeOutCubic,
3588     easeInOutCubic: easeInOutCubic,
3589     easeInQuart: easeInQuart,
3590     easeOutQuart: easeOutQuart,
3591     easeInOutQuart: easeInOutQuart,
3592     easeInQuint: easeInQuint,
3593     easeOutQuint: easeOutQuint,
3594     easeInOutQuint: easeInOutQuint,
3595     easeInSine: easeInSine,
3596     easeOutSine: easeOutSine,
3597     easeInOutSine: easeInOutSine,
3598     easeInExpo: easeInExpo,
3599     easeOutExpo: easeOutExpo,
3600     easeInOutExpo: easeInOutExpo,
3601     easeInCirc: easeInCirc,
3602     easeOutCirc: easeOutCirc,
3603     easeInOutCirc: easeInOutCirc,
3604     easeInElastic: easeInElastic,
3605     easeOutElastic: easeOutElastic,
3606     easeInOutElastic: easeInOutElastic,
3607     easeInBack: easeInBack,
3608     easeOutBack: easeOutBack,
3609     easeInOutBack: easeInOutBack,
3610     easeInBounce: easeInBounce,
3611     easeOutBounce: easeOutBounce,
3612     easeInOutBounce: easeInOutBounce
3613   };
3614 
3615 }());
3616 (function(global) {
3617 
3618   "use strict";
3619 
3620   /**
3621    * @name fabric
3622    * @namespace
3623    */
3624 
3625   var fabric = global.fabric || (global.fabric = { }),
3626       extend = fabric.util.object.extend,
3627       capitalize = fabric.util.string.capitalize,
3628       clone = fabric.util.object.clone;
3629 
3630   var attributesMap = {
3631     'cx':               'left',
3632     'x':                'left',
3633     'cy':               'top',
3634     'y':                'top',
3635     'r':                'radius',
3636     'fill-opacity':     'opacity',
3637     'fill-rule':        'fillRule',
3638     'stroke-width':     'strokeWidth',
3639     'transform':        'transformMatrix',
3640     'text-decoration':  'textDecoration',
3641     'font-size':        'fontSize',
3642     'font-weight':      'fontWeight',
3643     'font-style':       'fontStyle',
3644     'font-family':      'fontFamily'
3645   };
3646 
3647   function normalizeAttr(attr) {
3648     // transform attribute names
3649     if (attr in attributesMap) {
3650       return attributesMap[attr];
3651     }
3652     return attr;
3653   }
3654 
3655   /**
3656    * Returns an object of attributes' name/value, given element and an array of attribute names;
3657    * Parses parent "g" nodes recursively upwards.
3658    * @static
3659    * @memberOf fabric
3660    * @method parseAttributes
3661    * @param {DOMElement} element Element to parse
3662    * @param {Array} attributes Array of attributes to parse
3663    * @return {Object} object containing parsed attributes' names/values
3664    */
3665   function parseAttributes(element, attributes) {
3666 
3667     if (!element) {
3668       return;
3669     }
3670 
3671     var value,
3672         parsed,
3673         parentAttributes = { };
3674 
3675     // if there's a parent container (`g` node), parse its attributes recursively upwards
3676     if (element.parentNode && /^g$/i.test(element.parentNode.nodeName)) {
3677       parentAttributes = fabric.parseAttributes(element.parentNode, attributes);
3678     }
3679 
3680     var ownAttributes = attributes.reduce(function(memo, attr) {
3681       value = element.getAttribute(attr);
3682       parsed = parseFloat(value);
3683       if (value) {
3684         // "normalize" attribute values
3685         if ((attr === 'fill' || attr === 'stroke') && value === 'none') {
3686           value = '';
3687         }
3688         if (attr === 'fill-rule') {
3689           value = (value === 'evenodd') ? 'destination-over' : value;
3690         }
3691         if (attr === 'transform') {
3692           value = fabric.parseTransformAttribute(value);
3693         }
3694         attr = normalizeAttr(attr);
3695         memo[attr] = isNaN(parsed) ? value : parsed;
3696       }
3697       return memo;
3698     }, { });
3699 
3700     // add values parsed from style, which take precedence over attributes
3701     // (see: http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/styling.html#UsingPresentationAttributes)
3702 
3703     ownAttributes = extend(ownAttributes, extend(getGlobalStylesForElement(element), fabric.parseStyleAttribute(element)));
3704     return extend(parentAttributes, ownAttributes);
3705   }
3706 
3707   /**
3708    * Parses "transform" attribute, returning an array of values
3709    * @static
3710    * @function
3711    * @memberOf fabric
3712    * @method parseTransformAttribute
3713    * @param attributeValue {String} string containing attribute value
3714    * @return {Array} array of 6 elements representing transformation matrix
3715    */
3716   fabric.parseTransformAttribute = (function() {
3717     function rotateMatrix(matrix, args) {
3718       var angle = args[0];
3719 
3720       matrix[0] = Math.cos(angle);
3721       matrix[1] = Math.sin(angle);
3722       matrix[2] = -Math.sin(angle);
3723       matrix[3] = Math.cos(angle);
3724     }
3725 
3726     function scaleMatrix(matrix, args) {
3727       var multiplierX = args[0],
3728           multiplierY = (args.length === 2) ? args[1] : args[0];
3729 
3730       matrix[0] = multiplierX;
3731       matrix[3] = multiplierY;
3732     }
3733 
3734     function skewXMatrix(matrix, args) {
3735       matrix[2] = args[0];
3736     }
3737 
3738     function skewYMatrix(matrix, args) {
3739       matrix[1] = args[0];
3740     }
3741 
3742     function translateMatrix(matrix, args) {
3743       matrix[4] = args[0];
3744       if (args.length === 2) {
3745         matrix[5] = args[1];
3746       }
3747     }
3748 
3749     // identity matrix
3750     var iMatrix = [
3751           1, // a
3752           0, // b
3753           0, // c
3754           1, // d
3755           0, // e
3756           0  // f
3757         ],
3758 
3759         // == begin transform regexp
3760         number = '(?:[-+]?\\d+(?:\\.\\d+)?(?:e[-+]?\\d+)?)',
3761         comma_wsp = '(?:\\s+,?\\s*|,\\s*)',
3762 
3763         skewX = '(?:(skewX)\\s*\\(\\s*(' + number + ')\\s*\\))',
3764         skewY = '(?:(skewY)\\s*\\(\\s*(' + number + ')\\s*\\))',
3765         rotate = '(?:(rotate)\\s*\\(\\s*(' + number + ')(?:' + comma_wsp + '(' + number + ')' + comma_wsp + '(' + number + '))?\\s*\\))',
3766         scale = '(?:(scale)\\s*\\(\\s*(' + number + ')(?:' + comma_wsp + '(' + number + '))?\\s*\\))',
3767         translate = '(?:(translate)\\s*\\(\\s*(' + number + ')(?:' + comma_wsp + '(' + number + '))?\\s*\\))',
3768 
3769         matrix = '(?:(matrix)\\s*\\(\\s*' +
3770                   '(' + number + ')' + comma_wsp +
3771                   '(' + number + ')' + comma_wsp +
3772                   '(' + number + ')' + comma_wsp +
3773                   '(' + number + ')' + comma_wsp +
3774                   '(' + number + ')' + comma_wsp +
3775                   '(' + number + ')' +
3776                   '\\s*\\))',
3777 
3778         transform = '(?:' +
3779                     matrix + '|' +
3780                     translate + '|' +
3781                     scale + '|' +
3782                     rotate + '|' +
3783                     skewX + '|' +
3784                     skewY +
3785                     ')',
3786 
3787         transforms = '(?:' + transform + '(?:' + comma_wsp + transform + ')*' + ')',
3788 
3789         transform_list = '^\\s*(?:' + transforms + '?)\\s*$',
3790 
3791         // http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/coords.html#TransformAttribute
3792         reTransformList = new RegExp(transform_list),
3793         // == end transform regexp
3794 
3795         reTransform = new RegExp(transform);
3796 
3797     return function(attributeValue) {
3798 
3799       // start with identity matrix
3800       var matrix = iMatrix.concat();
3801 
3802       // return if no argument was given or
3803       // an argument does not match transform attribute regexp
3804       if (!attributeValue || (attributeValue && !reTransformList.test(attributeValue))) {
3805         return matrix;
3806       }
3807 
3808       attributeValue.replace(reTransform, function(match) {
3809 
3810         var m = new RegExp(transform).exec(match).filter(function (match) {
3811               return (match !== '' && match != null);
3812             }),
3813             operation = m[1],
3814             args = m.slice(2).map(parseFloat);
3815 
3816         switch(operation) {
3817           case 'translate':
3818             translateMatrix(matrix, args);
3819             break;
3820           case 'rotate':
3821             rotateMatrix(matrix, args);
3822             break;
3823           case 'scale':
3824             scaleMatrix(matrix, args);
3825             break;
3826           case 'skewX':
3827             skewXMatrix(matrix, args);
3828             break;
3829           case 'skewY':
3830             skewYMatrix(matrix, args);
3831             break;
3832           case 'matrix':
3833             matrix = args;
3834             break;
3835         }
3836       });
3837       return matrix;
3838     };
3839   })();
3840 
3841   /**
3842    * Parses "points" attribute, returning an array of values
3843    * @static
3844    * @memberOf fabric
3845    * @method parsePointsAttribute
3846    * @param points {String} points attribute string
3847    * @return {Array} array of points
3848    */
3849   function parsePointsAttribute(points) {
3850 
3851     // points attribute is required and must not be empty
3852     if (!points) return null;
3853 
3854     points = points.trim();
3855     var asPairs = points.indexOf(',') > -1;
3856 
3857     points = points.split(/\s+/);
3858     var parsedPoints = [ ], i, len;
3859 
3860     // points could look like "10,20 30,40" or "10 20 30 40"
3861     if (asPairs) {
3862       i = 0;
3863       len = points.length;
3864       for (; i < len; i++) {
3865         var pair = points[i].split(',');
3866         parsedPoints.push({ x: parseFloat(pair[0]), y: parseFloat(pair[1]) });
3867       }
3868     }
3869     else {
3870       i = 0;
3871       len = points.length;
3872       for (; i < len; i+=2) {
3873         parsedPoints.push({ x: parseFloat(points[i]), y: parseFloat(points[i+1]) });
3874       }
3875     }
3876 
3877     // odd number of points is an error
3878     if (parsedPoints.length % 2 !== 0) {
3879       // return null;
3880     }
3881 
3882     return parsedPoints;
3883   }
3884 
3885   /**
3886    * Parses "style" attribute, retuning an object with values
3887    * @static
3888    * @memberOf fabric
3889    * @method parseStyleAttribute
3890    * @param {SVGElement} element Element to parse
3891    * @return {Object} Objects with values parsed from style attribute of an element
3892    */
3893   function parseStyleAttribute(element) {
3894     var oStyle = { },
3895         style = element.getAttribute('style');
3896 
3897     if (!style) return oStyle;
3898 
3899     if (typeof style === 'string') {
3900       style = style.replace(/;$/, '').split(';').forEach(function (current) {
3901 
3902         var attr = current.split(':');
3903         var value = attr[1].trim();
3904 
3905         // TODO: need to normalize em, %, pt, etc. to px (!)
3906         var parsed = parseFloat(value);
3907 
3908         oStyle[normalizeAttr(attr[0].trim().toLowerCase())] = isNaN(parsed) ? value : parsed;
3909       });
3910     }
3911     else {
3912       for (var prop in style) {
3913         if (typeof style[prop] === 'undefined') continue;
3914 
3915         var parsed = parseFloat(style[prop]);
3916         oStyle[normalizeAttr(prop.toLowerCase())] = isNaN(parsed) ? style[prop] : parsed;
3917       }
3918     }
3919 
3920     return oStyle;
3921   }
3922 
3923   function resolveGradients(instances) {
3924     for (var i = instances.length; i--; ) {
3925       var instanceFillValue = instances[i].get('fill');
3926 
3927       if (/^url\(/.test(instanceFillValue)) {
3928 
3929         var gradientId = instanceFillValue.slice(5, instanceFillValue.length - 1);
3930 
3931         if (fabric.gradientDefs[gradientId]) {
3932           instances[i].set('fill',
3933             fabric.Gradient.fromElement(fabric.gradientDefs[gradientId], instances[i]));
3934         }
3935       }
3936     }
3937   }
3938 
3939   /**
3940    * Transforms an array of svg elements to corresponding fabric.* instances
3941    * @static
3942    * @memberOf fabric
3943    * @method parseElements
3944    * @param {Array} elements Array of elements to parse
3945    * @param {Function} callback Being passed an array of fabric instances (transformed from SVG elements)
3946    * @param {Object} [options] Options object
3947    * @param {Function} [reviver] Method for further parsing of SVG elements, called after each fabric object created.
3948    */
3949   function parseElements(elements, callback, options, reviver) {
3950     var instances = new Array(elements.length), i = elements.length;
3951 
3952     function checkIfDone() {
3953       if (--i === 0) {
3954         instances = instances.filter(function(el) {
3955           return el != null;
3956         });
3957         resolveGradients(instances);
3958         callback(instances);
3959       }
3960     }
3961 
3962     for (var index = 0, el, len = elements.length; index < len; index++) {
3963       el = elements[index];
3964       var klass = fabric[capitalize(el.tagName)];
3965       if (klass && klass.fromElement) {
3966         try {
3967           if (klass.async) {
3968             klass.fromElement(el, (function(index, el) {
3969               return function(obj) {
3970                 reviver && reviver(el, obj);
3971                 instances.splice(index, 0, obj);
3972                 checkIfDone();
3973               };
3974             })(index), options);
3975           }
3976           else {
3977             var obj = klass.fromElement(el, options);
3978             reviver && reviver(el, obj);
3979             instances.splice(index, 0, obj);
3980             checkIfDone();
3981           }
3982         }
3983         catch(e) {
3984           fabric.log(e.message || e);
3985         }
3986       }
3987       else {
3988         checkIfDone();
3989       }
3990     }
3991   }
3992 
3993   /**
3994    * Returns CSS rules for a given SVG document
3995    * @static
3996    * @function
3997    * @memberOf fabric
3998    * @method getCSSRules
3999    * @param {SVGDocument} doc SVG document to parse
4000    * @return {Object} CSS rules of this document
4001    */
4002   function getCSSRules(doc) {
4003     var styles = doc.getElementsByTagName('style'),
4004         allRules = { },
4005         rules;
4006 
4007     // very crude parsing of style contents
4008     for (var i = 0, len = styles.length; i < len; i++) {
4009       var styleContents = styles[0].textContent;
4010 
4011       // remove comments
4012       styleContents = styleContents.replace(/\/\*[\s\S]*?\*\//g, '');
4013 
4014       rules = styleContents.match(/[^{]*\{[\s\S]*?\}/g);
4015       rules = rules.map(function(rule) { return rule.trim(); });
4016 
4017       rules.forEach(function(rule) {
4018         var match = rule.match(/([\s\S]*?)\s*\{([^}]*)\}/);
4019         rule = match[1];
4020         var declaration = match[2].trim(),
4021             propertyValuePairs = declaration.replace(/;$/, '').split(/\s*;\s*/);
4022 
4023         if (!allRules[rule]) {
4024           allRules[rule] = { };
4025         }
4026 
4027         for (var i = 0, len = propertyValuePairs.length; i < len; i++) {
4028           var pair = propertyValuePairs[i].split(/\s*:\s*/),
4029               property = pair[0],
4030               value = pair[1];
4031 
4032           allRules[rule][property] = value;
4033         }
4034       });
4035     }
4036 
4037     return allRules;
4038   }
4039 
4040   /**
4041    * @private
4042    */
4043   function getGlobalStylesForElement(element) {
4044     var nodeName = element.nodeName,
4045         className = element.getAttribute('class'),
4046         id = element.getAttribute('id'),
4047         styles = { };
4048 
4049     for (var rule in fabric.cssRules) {
4050       var ruleMatchesElement = (className && new RegExp('^\\.' + className).test(rule)) ||
4051                                (id && new RegExp('^#' + id).test(rule)) ||
4052                                (new RegExp('^' + nodeName).test(rule));
4053 
4054       if (ruleMatchesElement) {
4055         for (var property in fabric.cssRules[rule]) {
4056           styles[property] = fabric.cssRules[rule][property];
4057         }
4058       }
4059     }
4060 
4061     return styles;
4062   }
4063 
4064   /**
4065    * Parses an SVG document, converts it to an array of corresponding fabric.* instances and passes them to a callback
4066    * @static
4067    * @function
4068    * @memberOf fabric
4069    * @method parseSVGDocument
4070    * @param {SVGDocument} doc SVG document to parse
4071    * @param {Function} callback Callback to call when parsing is finished; It's being passed an array of elements (parsed from a document).
4072    * @param {Function} [reviver] Method for further parsing of SVG elements, called after each fabric object created.
4073    */
4074   fabric.parseSVGDocument = (function() {
4075 
4076     var reAllowedSVGTagNames = /^(path|circle|polygon|polyline|ellipse|rect|line|image|text)$/;
4077 
4078     // http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/coords.html#ViewBoxAttribute
4079     // \d doesn't quite cut it (as we need to match an actual float number)
4080 
4081     // matches, e.g.: +14.56e-12, etc.
4082     var reNum = '(?:[-+]?\\d+(?:\\.\\d+)?(?:e[-+]?\\d+)?)';
4083 
4084     var reViewBoxAttrValue = new RegExp(
4085       '^' +
4086       '\\s*(' + reNum + '+)\\s*,?' +
4087       '\\s*(' + reNum + '+)\\s*,?' +
4088       '\\s*(' + reNum + '+)\\s*,?' +
4089       '\\s*(' + reNum + '+)\\s*' +
4090       '$'
4091     );
4092 
4093     function hasAncestorWithNodeName(element, nodeName) {
4094       while (element && (element = element.parentNode)) {
4095         if (nodeName.test(element.nodeName)) {
4096           return true;
4097         }
4098       }
4099       return false;
4100     }
4101 
4102     return function(doc, callback, reviver) {
4103       if (!doc) return;
4104 
4105       var startTime = new Date(),
4106           descendants = fabric.util.toArray(doc.getElementsByTagName('*'));
4107 
4108       if (descendants.length === 0) {
4109         // we're likely in node, where "o3-xml" library fails to gEBTN("*")
4110         // https://github.com/ajaxorg/node-o3-xml/issues/21
4111         descendants = doc.selectNodes("//*[name(.)!='svg']");
4112         var arr = [ ];
4113         for (var i = 0, len = descendants.length; i < len; i++) {
4114           arr[i] = descendants[i];
4115         }
4116         descendants = arr;
4117       }
4118 
4119       var elements = descendants.filter(function(el) {
4120         return reAllowedSVGTagNames.test(el.tagName) &&
4121               !hasAncestorWithNodeName(el, /^(?:pattern|defs)$/); // http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/struct.html#DefsElement
4122       });
4123 
4124       if (!elements || (elements && !elements.length)) return;
4125 
4126       var viewBoxAttr = doc.getAttribute('viewBox'),
4127           widthAttr = doc.getAttribute('width'),
4128           heightAttr = doc.getAttribute('height'),
4129           width = null,
4130           height = null,
4131           minX,
4132           minY;
4133 
4134       if (viewBoxAttr && (viewBoxAttr = viewBoxAttr.match(reViewBoxAttrValue))) {
4135         minX = parseInt(viewBoxAttr[1], 10);
4136         minY = parseInt(viewBoxAttr[2], 10);
4137         width = parseInt(viewBoxAttr[3], 10);
4138         height = parseInt(viewBoxAttr[4], 10);
4139       }
4140 
4141       // values of width/height attributes overwrite those extracted from viewbox attribute
4142       width = widthAttr ? parseFloat(widthAttr) : width;
4143       height = heightAttr ? parseFloat(heightAttr) : height;
4144 
4145       var options = {
4146         width: width,
4147         height: height
4148       };
4149 
4150       fabric.gradientDefs = fabric.getGradientDefs(doc);
4151       fabric.cssRules = getCSSRules(doc);
4152 
4153       // Precedence of rules:   style > class > attribute
4154 
4155       fabric.parseElements(elements, function(instances) {
4156         fabric.documentParsingTime = new Date() - startTime;
4157         if (callback) {
4158           callback(instances, options);
4159         }
4160       }, clone(options), reviver);
4161     };
4162   })();
4163 
4164   /**
4165     * Used for caching SVG documents (loaded via `fabric.Canvas#loadSVGFromURL`)
4166     * @property
4167     * @namespace
4168     */
4169    var svgCache = {
4170 
4171      /**
4172       * @method has
4173       * @param {String} name
4174       * @param {Function} callback
4175       */
4176      has: function (name, callback) {
4177        callback(false);
4178      },
4179 
4180      /**
4181       * @method get
4182       * @param {String} url
4183       * @param {Function} callback
4184       */
4185      get: function () {
4186        /* NOOP */
4187      },
4188 
4189      /**
4190       * @method set
4191       * @param {String} url
4192       * @param {Object} object
4193       */
4194      set: function () {
4195        /* NOOP */
4196      }
4197    };
4198 
4199    /**
4200     * Takes url corresponding to an SVG document, and parses it into a set of fabric objects
4201     * @method loadSVGFromURL
4202     * @memberof fabric
4203     * @param {String} url
4204     * @param {Function} callback
4205     * @param {Function} [reviver] Method for further parsing of SVG elements, called after each fabric object created.
4206     */
4207    function loadSVGFromURL(url, callback, reviver) {
4208 
4209      url = url.replace(/^\n\s*/, '').trim();
4210 
4211      svgCache.has(url, function (hasUrl) {
4212        if (hasUrl) {
4213          svgCache.get(url, function (value) {
4214            var enlivedRecord = _enlivenCachedObject(value);
4215            callback(enlivedRecord.objects, enlivedRecord.options);
4216          });
4217        }
4218        else {
4219          new fabric.util.request(url, {
4220            method: 'get',
4221            onComplete: onComplete
4222          });
4223        }
4224      });
4225 
4226      function onComplete(r) {
4227 
4228        var xml = r.responseXML;
4229        if (!xml.documentElement && fabric.window.ActiveXObject && r.responseText) {
4230          xml = new ActiveXObject('Microsoft.XMLDOM');
4231          xml.async = 'false';
4232          //IE chokes on DOCTYPE
4233          xml.loadXML(r.responseText.replace(/<!DOCTYPE[\s\S]*?(\[[\s\S]*\])*?>/i,''));
4234        }
4235        if (!xml.documentElement) return;
4236 
4237        fabric.parseSVGDocument(xml.documentElement, function (results, options) {
4238          svgCache.set(url, {
4239            objects: fabric.util.array.invoke(results, 'toObject'),
4240            options: options
4241          });
4242          callback(results, options);
4243        }, reviver);
4244      }
4245    }
4246 
4247   /**
4248   * @method _enlivenCachedObject
4249   */
4250   function _enlivenCachedObject(cachedObject) {
4251 
4252    var objects = cachedObject.objects,
4253        options = cachedObject.options;
4254 
4255    objects = objects.map(function (o) {
4256      return fabric[capitalize(o.type)].fromObject(o);
4257    });
4258 
4259    return ({ objects: objects, options: options });
4260   }
4261 
4262   /**
4263     * Takes string corresponding to an SVG document, and parses it into a set of fabric objects
4264     * @method loadSVGFromString
4265     * @memberof fabric
4266     * @param {String} string
4267     * @param {Function} callback
4268     * @param {Function} [reviver] Method for further parsing of SVG elements, called after each fabric object created.
4269     */
4270   function loadSVGFromString(string, callback, reviver) {
4271     string = string.trim();
4272     var doc;
4273     if (typeof DOMParser !== 'undefined') {
4274       var parser = new DOMParser();
4275       if (parser && parser.parseFromString) {
4276         doc = parser.parseFromString(string, 'text/xml');
4277       }
4278     }
4279     else if (fabric.window.ActiveXObject) {
4280       doc = new ActiveXObject('Microsoft.XMLDOM');
4281       doc.async = 'false';
4282       //IE chokes on DOCTYPE
4283       doc.loadXML(string.replace(/<!DOCTYPE[\s\S]*?(\[[\s\S]*\])*?>/i,''));
4284     }
4285 
4286     fabric.parseSVGDocument(doc.documentElement, function (results, options) {
4287       callback(results, options);
4288     }, reviver);
4289   }
4290 
4291   /**
4292    * Creates markup containing SVG font faces
4293    * @method createSVGFontFacesMarkup
4294    * @param {Array} objects Array of fabric objects
4295    * @return {String}
4296    */
4297   function createSVGFontFacesMarkup(objects) {
4298     var markup = '';
4299 
4300     for (var i = 0, len = objects.length; i < len; i++) {
4301       if (objects[i].type !== 'text' || !objects[i].path) continue;
4302 
4303       markup += [
4304         '@font-face {',
4305           'font-family: ', objects[i].fontFamily, '; ',
4306           'src: url(\'', objects[i].path, '\')',
4307         '}'
4308       ].join('');
4309     }
4310 
4311     if (markup) {
4312       markup = [
4313         '<defs>',
4314           '<style type="text/css">',
4315             '<![CDATA[',
4316               markup,
4317             ']]>',
4318           '</style>',
4319         '</defs>'
4320       ].join('');
4321     }
4322 
4323     return markup;
4324   }
4325 
4326   extend(fabric, {
4327 
4328     parseAttributes:          parseAttributes,
4329     parseElements:            parseElements,
4330     parseStyleAttribute:      parseStyleAttribute,
4331     parsePointsAttribute:     parsePointsAttribute,
4332     getCSSRules:              getCSSRules,
4333 
4334     loadSVGFromURL:           loadSVGFromURL,
4335     loadSVGFromString:        loadSVGFromString,
4336 
4337     createSVGFontFacesMarkup: createSVGFontFacesMarkup
4338   });
4339 
4340 })(typeof exports !== 'undefined' ? exports : this);
4341 
4342 (function() {
4343 
4344   function getColorStopFromStyle(el) {
4345     var style = el.getAttribute('style');
4346 
4347     if (style) {
4348       var keyValuePairs = style.split(/\s*;\s*/);
4349 
4350       if (keyValuePairs[keyValuePairs.length-1] === '') {
4351         keyValuePairs.pop();
4352       }
4353 
4354       for (var i = keyValuePairs.length; i--; ) {
4355 
4356         var split = keyValuePairs[i].split(/\s*:\s*/),
4357             key = split[0].trim(),
4358             value = split[1].trim();
4359 
4360         if (key === 'stop-color') {
4361           return value;
4362         }
4363       }
4364     }
4365   }
4366 
4367   /**
4368    * Gradient class
4369    * @class Gradient
4370    * @memberOf fabric
4371    */
4372   fabric.Gradient = fabric.util.createClass(/** @scope fabric.Gradient.prototype */ {
4373 
4374     /**
4375      * Constructor
4376      * @method initialize
4377      * @param [options] Options object with x1, y1, x2, y2 and colorStops
4378      * @return {fabric.Gradient} thisArg
4379      */
4380     initialize: function(options) {
4381 
4382       options || (options = { });
4383 
4384       this.x1 = options.x1 || 0;
4385       this.y1 = options.y1 || 0;
4386       this.x2 = options.x2 || 0;
4387       this.y2 = options.y2 || 0;
4388 
4389       this.colorStops = options.colorStops;
4390     },
4391 
4392     /**
4393      * Returns object representation of a gradient
4394      * @method toObject
4395      * @return {Object}
4396      */
4397     toObject: function() {
4398       return {
4399         x1: this.x1,
4400         x2: this.x2,
4401         y1: this.y1,
4402         y2: this.y2,
4403         colorStops: this.colorStops
4404       };
4405     },
4406 
4407     /**
4408      * Returns an instance of CanvasGradient
4409      * @method toLiveGradient
4410      * @param ctx
4411      * @return {CanvasGradient}
4412      */
4413     toLiveGradient: function(ctx) {
4414       var gradient = ctx.createLinearGradient(
4415         this.x1, this.y1, this.x2 || ctx.canvas.width, this.y2);
4416 
4417       for (var position in this.colorStops) {
4418         var colorValue = this.colorStops[position];
4419         gradient.addColorStop(parseFloat(position), colorValue);
4420       }
4421 
4422       return gradient;
4423     }
4424   });
4425 
4426   fabric.util.object.extend(fabric.Gradient, {
4427 
4428     /**
4429      * Returns {@link fabric.Gradient} instance from an SVG element
4430      * @method fromElement
4431      * @static
4432      * @memberof fabric.Gradient
4433      * @see http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/pservers.html#LinearGradientElement
4434      */
4435     fromElement: function(el, instance) {
4436 
4437       /**
4438        *  @example:
4439        *
4440        *  <linearGradient id="grad1">
4441        *    <stop offset="0%" stop-color="white"/>
4442        *    <stop offset="100%" stop-color="black"/>
4443        *  </linearGradient>
4444        *
4445        *  OR
4446        *
4447        *  <linearGradient id="grad1">
4448        *    <stop offset="0%" style="stop-color:rgb(255,255,255)"/>
4449        *    <stop offset="100%" style="stop-color:rgb(0,0,0)"/>
4450        *  </linearGradient>
4451        *
4452        */
4453 
4454       var colorStopEls = el.getElementsByTagName('stop'),
4455           offset,
4456           colorStops = { },
4457           coords = {
4458             x1: el.getAttribute('x1') || 0,
4459             y1: el.getAttribute('y1') || 0,
4460             x2: el.getAttribute('x2') || '100%',
4461             y2: el.getAttribute('y2') || 0
4462           };
4463 
4464       for (var i = colorStopEls.length; i--; ) {
4465         el = colorStopEls[i];
4466         offset = el.getAttribute('offset');
4467 
4468         // convert percents to absolute values
4469         offset = parseFloat(offset) / (/%$/.test(offset) ? 100 : 1);
4470         colorStops[offset] = getColorStopFromStyle(el) || el.getAttribute('stop-color');
4471       }
4472 
4473       _convertPercentUnitsToValues(instance, coords);
4474 
4475       return new fabric.Gradient({
4476         x1: coords.x1,
4477         y1: coords.y1,
4478         x2: coords.x2,
4479         y2: coords.y2,
4480         colorStops: colorStops
4481       });
4482     },
4483 
4484     /**
4485      * Returns {@link fabric.Gradient} instance from its object representation
4486      * @method forObject
4487      * @static
4488      * @param obj
4489      * @param [options]
4490      * @memberof fabric.Gradient
4491      */
4492     forObject: function(obj, options) {
4493       options || (options = { });
4494       _convertPercentUnitsToValues(obj, options);
4495       return new fabric.Gradient(options);
4496     }
4497   });
4498 
4499   function _convertPercentUnitsToValues(object, options) {
4500     for (var prop in options) {
4501       if (typeof options[prop] === 'string' && /^\d+%$/.test(options[prop])) {
4502         var percents = parseFloat(options[prop], 10);
4503         if (prop === 'x1' || prop === 'x2') {
4504           options[prop] = fabric.util.toFixed(object.width * percents / 100, 2);
4505         }
4506         else if (prop === 'y1' || prop === 'y2') {
4507           options[prop] = fabric.util.toFixed(object.height * percents / 100, 2);
4508         }
4509       }
4510       // normalize rendering point (should be from top/left corner rather than center of the shape)
4511       if (prop === 'x1' || prop === 'x2') {
4512         options[prop] -= fabric.util.toFixed(object.width / 2, 2);
4513       }
4514       else if (prop === 'y1' || prop === 'y2') {
4515         options[prop] -= fabric.util.toFixed(object.height / 2, 2);
4516       }
4517     }
4518   }
4519 
4520   /**
4521    * Parses an SVG document, returning all of the gradient declarations found in it
4522    * @static
4523    * @function
4524    * @memberOf fabric
4525    * @method getGradientDefs
4526    * @param {SVGDocument} doc SVG document to parse
4527    * @return {Object} Gradient definitions; key corresponds to element id, value -- to gradient definition element
4528    */
4529   function getGradientDefs(doc) {
4530     var linearGradientEls = doc.getElementsByTagName('linearGradient'),
4531         radialGradientEls = doc.getElementsByTagName('radialGradient'),
4532         el, i,
4533         gradientDefs = { };
4534 
4535     i = linearGradientEls.length;
4536     for (; i--; ) {
4537       el = linearGradientEls[i];
4538       gradientDefs[el.getAttribute('id')] = el;
4539     }
4540 
4541     i = radialGradientEls.length;
4542     for (; i--; ) {
4543       el = radialGradientEls[i];
4544       gradientDefs[el.getAttribute('id')] = el;
4545     }
4546 
4547     return gradientDefs;
4548   }
4549 
4550   fabric.getGradientDefs = getGradientDefs;
4551 
4552 })();
4553 (function(global) {
4554 
4555   "use strict";
4556 
4557   /* Adaptation of work of Kevin Lindsey (kevin@kevlindev.com) */
4558 
4559   var fabric = global.fabric || (global.fabric = { });
4560 
4561   if (fabric.Point) {
4562     fabric.warn('fabric.Point is already defined');
4563     return;
4564   }
4565 
4566   fabric.Point = Point;
4567 
4568   /**
4569    * Point class
4570    * @name Point
4571    * @memberOf fabric
4572    * @constructor
4573    * @param {Number} x
4574    * @param {Number} y
4575    * @return {fabric.Point} thisArg
4576    */
4577   function Point(x, y) {
4578     if (arguments.length > 0) {
4579       this.init(x, y);
4580     }
4581   }
4582 
4583   Point.prototype = /** @scope fabric.Point.prototype */ {
4584 
4585     constructor: Point,
4586 
4587     /**
4588      * Constructor
4589      * @method init
4590      * @param {Number} x left offset
4591      * @param {Number} y top offset
4592      */
4593     init: function (x, y) {
4594       this.x = x;
4595       this.y = y;
4596     },
4597 
4598     /**
4599      * Adds another point to this one and returns another one
4600      * @method add
4601      * @param {fabric.Point} that
4602      * @return {fabric.Point} new Point instance with added values
4603      */
4604     add: function (that) {
4605       return new Point(this.x + that.x, this.y + that.y);
4606     },
4607 
4608     /**
4609      * Adds another point to this one
4610      * @method addEquals
4611      * @param {fabric.Point} that
4612      * @return {fabric.Point} thisArg
4613      */
4614     addEquals: function (that) {
4615       this.x += that.x;
4616       this.y += that.y;
4617       return this;
4618     },
4619 
4620     /**
4621      * Adds value to this point and returns a new one
4622      * @method scalarAdd
4623      * @param {Number} scalar
4624      * @return {fabric.Point} new Point with added value
4625      */
4626     scalarAdd: function (scalar) {
4627       return new Point(this.x + scalar, this.y + scalar);
4628     },
4629 
4630     /**
4631      * Adds value to this point
4632      * @method scalarAddEquals
4633      * @param {Number} scalar
4634      * @param {fabric.Point} thisArg
4635      */
4636     scalarAddEquals: function (scalar) {
4637       this.x += scalar;
4638       this.y += scalar;
4639       return this;
4640     },
4641 
4642     /**
4643      * Subtracts another point from this point and returns a new one
4644      * @method subtract
4645      * @param {fabric.Point} that
4646      * @return {fabric.Point} new Point object with subtracted values
4647      */
4648     subtract: function (that) {
4649       return new Point(this.x - that.x, this.y - that.y);
4650     },
4651 
4652     /**
4653      * Subtracts another point from this point
4654      * @method subtractEquals
4655      * @param {fabric.Point} that
4656      * @return {fabric.Point} thisArg
4657      */
4658     subtractEquals: function (that) {
4659       this.x -= that.x;
4660       this.y -= that.y;
4661       return this;
4662     },
4663 
4664     /**
4665      * Subtracts value from this point and returns a new one
4666      * @method scalarSubtract
4667      * @param {Number} scalar
4668      * @return {fabric.Point}
4669      */
4670     scalarSubtract: function (scalar) {
4671       return new Point(this.x - scalar, this.y - scalar);
4672     },
4673 
4674     /**
4675      * Subtracts value from this point
4676      * @method scalarSubtractEquals
4677      * @param {Number} scalar
4678      * @return {fabric.Point} thisArg
4679      */
4680     scalarSubtractEquals: function (scalar) {
4681       this.x -= scalar;
4682       this.y -= scalar;
4683       return this;
4684     },
4685 
4686     /**
