11847      * @method toSVG
11848      * @return {String} svg representation of an instance
11849      */
11850     toSVG: function() {
11851       var points = [];
11852       for (var i = 0, len = this.points.length; i < len; i++) {
11853         points.push(toFixed(this.points[i].x, 2), ',', toFixed(this.points[i].y, 2), ' ');
11854       }
11855 
11856       return [
11857         '<polygon ',
11858           'points="', points.join(''), '" ',
11859           'style="', this.getSvgStyles(), '" ',
11860           'transform="', this.getSvgTransform(), '" ',
11861         '/>'
11862       ].join('');
11863     },
11864 
11865     /**
11866      * @private
11867      * @method _render
11868      * @param ctx {CanvasRenderingContext2D} context to render on
11869      */
11870     _render: function(ctx) {
11871       var point;
11872       ctx.beginPath();
11873       ctx.moveTo(this.points[0].x, this.points[0].y);
11874       for (var i = 0, len = this.points.length; i < len; i++) {
11875         point = this.points[i];
11876         ctx.lineTo(point.x, point.y);
11877       }
11878       if (this.fill) {
11879         ctx.fill();
11880       }
11881       if (this.stroke) {
11882         ctx.closePath();
11883         ctx.stroke();
11884       }
11885     },
11886 
11887     /**
11888      * Returns complexity of an instance
11889      * @method complexity
11890      * @return {Number} complexity of this instance
11891      */
11892     complexity: function() {
11893       return this.points.length;
11894     }
11895   });
11896 
11897   /**
11898    * List of attribute names to account for when parsing SVG element (used by `fabric.Polygon.fromElement`)
11899    * @static
11900    * @see: http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/shapes.html#PolygonElement
11901    */
11902   fabric.Polygon.ATTRIBUTE_NAMES = 'fill fill-opacity opacity stroke stroke-width transform'.split(' ');
11903 
11904   /**
11905    * Returns {@link fabric.Polygon} instance from an SVG element
11906    * @static
11907    * @method fabric.Polygon.fromElement
11908    * @param {SVGElement} element Element to parse
11909    * @param {Object} [options] Options object
11910    * @return {fabric.Polygon}
11911    */
11912   fabric.Polygon.fromElement = function(element, options) {
11913     if (!element) {
11914       return null;
11915     }
11916     options || (options = { });
11917 
11918     var points = fabric.parsePointsAttribute(element.getAttribute('points')),
11919         parsedAttributes = fabric.parseAttributes(element, fabric.Polygon.ATTRIBUTE_NAMES);
11920 
11921     for (var i = 0, len = points.length; i < len; i++) {
11922       // normalize coordinates, according to containing box (dimensions of which are passed via `options`)
11923       points[i].x -= (options.width / 2) || 0;
11924       points[i].y -= (options.height / 2) || 0;
11925     }
11926 
11927     return new fabric.Polygon(points, extend(parsedAttributes, options));
11928   };
11929 
11930   /**
11931    * Returns fabric.Polygon instance from an object representation
11932    * @static
11933    * @method fabric.Polygon.fromObject
11934    * @param {Object} object Object to create an instance from
11935    * @return {fabric.Polygon}
11936    */
11937   fabric.Polygon.fromObject = function(object) {
11938     return new fabric.Polygon(object.points, object);
11939   };
11940 
11941 })(typeof exports !== 'undefined' ? exports : this);
11942 (function(global) {
11943 
11944   var commandLengths = {
11945     m: 2,
11946     l: 2,
11947     h: 1,
11948     v: 1,
11949     c: 6,
11950     s: 4,
11951     q: 4,
11952     t: 2,
11953     a: 7
11954   };
11955 
11956   function drawArc(ctx, x, y, coords) {
11957     var rx = coords[0];
11958     var ry = coords[1];
11959     var rot = coords[2];
11960     var large = coords[3];
11961     var sweep = coords[4];
11962     var ex = coords[5];
11963     var ey = coords[6];
11964     var segs = arcToSegments(ex, ey, rx, ry, large, sweep, rot, x, y);
11965     for (var i=0; i<segs.length; i++) {
11966      var bez = segmentToBezier.apply(this, segs[i]);
11967      ctx.bezierCurveTo.apply(ctx, bez);
11968     }
11969   }
11970 
11971   var arcToSegmentsCache = { },
11972       segmentToBezierCache = { },
11973       _join = Array.prototype.join,
11974       argsString;
11975 
11976   // Generous contribution by Raph Levien, from libsvg-0.1.0.tar.gz
11977   function arcToSegments(x, y, rx, ry, large, sweep, rotateX, ox, oy) {
11978     argsString = _join.call(arguments);
11979     if (arcToSegmentsCache[argsString]) {
11980       return arcToSegmentsCache[argsString];
11981     }
11982 
11983     var th = rotateX * (Math.PI/180);
11984     var sin_th = Math.sin(th);
11985     var cos_th = Math.cos(th);
11986     rx = Math.abs(rx);
11987     ry = Math.abs(ry);
11988     var px = cos_th * (ox - x) * 0.5 + sin_th * (oy - y) * 0.5;
11989     var py = cos_th * (oy - y) * 0.5 - sin_th * (ox - x) * 0.5;
11990     var pl = (px*px) / (rx*rx) + (py*py) / (ry*ry);
11991     if (pl > 1) {
11992       pl = Math.sqrt(pl);
11993       rx *= pl;
11994       ry *= pl;
11995     }
11996 
11997     var a00 = cos_th / rx;
11998     var a01 = sin_th / rx;
11999     var a10 = (-sin_th) / ry;
12000     var a11 = (cos_th) / ry;
12001     var x0 = a00 * ox + a01 * oy;
12002     var y0 = a10 * ox + a11 * oy;
12003     var x1 = a00 * x + a01 * y;
12004     var y1 = a10 * x + a11 * y;
12005 
12006     var d = (x1-x0) * (x1-x0) + (y1-y0) * (y1-y0);
12007     var sfactor_sq = 1 / d - 0.25;
12008     if (sfactor_sq < 0) sfactor_sq = 0;
12009     var sfactor = Math.sqrt(sfactor_sq);
12010     if (sweep === large) sfactor = -sfactor;
12011     var xc = 0.5 * (x0 + x1) - sfactor * (y1-y0);
12012     var yc = 0.5 * (y0 + y1) + sfactor * (x1-x0);
12013 
12014     var th0 = Math.atan2(y0-yc, x0-xc);
12015     var th1 = Math.atan2(y1-yc, x1-xc);
12016 
12017     var th_arc = th1-th0;
12018     if (th_arc < 0 && sweep === 1){
12019       th_arc += 2*Math.PI;
12020     } else if (th_arc > 0 && sweep === 0) {
12021       th_arc -= 2 * Math.PI;
12022     }
12023 
12024     var segments = Math.ceil(Math.abs(th_arc / (Math.PI * 0.5 + 0.001)));
12025     var result = [];
12026     for (var i=0; i<segments; i++) {
12027       var th2 = th0 + i * th_arc / segments;
12028       var th3 = th0 + (i+1) * th_arc / segments;
12029       result[i] = [xc, yc, th2, th3, rx, ry, sin_th, cos_th];
12030     }
12031 
12032     return (arcToSegmentsCache[argsString] = result);
12033   }
12034 
12035   function segmentToBezier(cx, cy, th0, th1, rx, ry, sin_th, cos_th) {
12036     argsString = _join.call(arguments);
12037     if (segmentToBezierCache[argsString]) {
12038       return segmentToBezierCache[argsString];
12039     }
12040 
12041     var a00 = cos_th * rx;
12042     var a01 = -sin_th * ry;
12043     var a10 = sin_th * rx;
12044     var a11 = cos_th * ry;
12045 
12046     var th_half = 0.5 * (th1 - th0);
12047     var t = (8/3) * Math.sin(th_half * 0.5) * Math.sin(th_half * 0.5) / Math.sin(th_half);
12048     var x1 = cx + Math.cos(th0) - t * Math.sin(th0);
12049     var y1 = cy + Math.sin(th0) + t * Math.cos(th0);
12050     var x3 = cx + Math.cos(th1);
12051     var y3 = cy + Math.sin(th1);
12052     var x2 = x3 + t * Math.sin(th1);
12053     var y2 = y3 - t * Math.cos(th1);
12054 
12055     return (segmentToBezierCache[argsString] = [
12056       a00 * x1 + a01 * y1,      a10 * x1 + a11 * y1,
12057       a00 * x2 + a01 * y2,      a10 * x2 + a11 * y2,
12058       a00 * x3 + a01 * y3,      a10 * x3 + a11 * y3
12059     ]);
12060   }
12061 
12062   "use strict";
12063 
12064   var fabric = global.fabric || (global.fabric = { }),
12065       min = fabric.util.array.min,
12066       max = fabric.util.array.max,
12067       extend = fabric.util.object.extend,
12068       _toString = Object.prototype.toString;
12069 
12070   if (fabric.Path) {
12071     fabric.warn('fabric.Path is already defined');
12072     return;
12073   }
12074 
12075   /**
12076    * @private
12077    */
12078   function getX(item) {
12079     if (item[0] === 'H') {
12080       return item[1];
12081     }
12082     return item[item.length - 2];
12083   }
12084 
12085   /**
12086    * @private
12087    */
12088   function getY(item) {
12089     if (item[0] === 'V') {
12090       return item[1];
12091     }
12092     return item[item.length - 1];
12093   }
12094 
12095   /**
12096    * Path class
12097    * @class Path
12098    * @extends fabric.Object
12099    */
12100   fabric.Path = fabric.util.createClass(fabric.Object, /** @scope fabric.Path.prototype */ {
12101 
12102     /**
12103      * Type of an object
12104      * @property
12105      * @type String
12106      */
12107     type: 'path',
12108 
12109     /**
12110      * Constructor
12111      * @method initialize
12112      * @param {Array|String} path Path data (sequence of coordinates and corresponding "command" tokens)
12113      * @param {Object} [options] Options object
12114      */
12115     initialize: function(path, options) {
12116       options = options || { };
12117 
12118       this.setOptions(options);
12119 
12120       if (!path) {
12121         throw new Error('`path` argument is required');
12122       }
12123 
12124       var fromArray = _toString.call(path) === '[object Array]';
12125 
12126       this.path = fromArray
12127         ? path
12128         // one of commands (m,M,l,L,q,Q,c,C,etc.) followed by non-command characters (i.e. command values)
12129         : path.match && path.match(/[mzlhvcsqta][^mzlhvcsqta]*/gi);
12130 
12131       if (!this.path) return;
12132 
12133       if (!fromArray) {
12134         this.path = this._parsePath();
12135       }
12136       this._initializePath(options);
12137 
12138       if (options.sourcePath) {
12139         this.setSourcePath(options.sourcePath);
12140       }
12141     },
12142 
12143     /**
12144      * @private
12145      * @method _initializePath
12146      */
12147     _initializePath: function (options) {
12148       var isWidthSet = 'width' in options,
12149           isHeightSet = 'height' in options,
12150           isLeftSet = 'left' in options,
12151           isTopSet = 'top' in options;
12152 
12153       if (!isWidthSet || !isHeightSet) {
12154         extend(this, this._parseDimensions());
12155         if (isWidthSet) {
12156           this.width = options.width;
12157         }
12158         if (isHeightSet) {
12159           this.height = options.height;
12160         }
12161       }
12162       else { //Set center location relative to given height/width if not specified
12163         if (!isTopSet) {
12164           this.top = this.height / 2;
12165         }
12166         if (!isLeftSet) {
12167           this.left = this.width / 2;
12168         }
12169       }
12170       this.pathOffset = this._calculatePathOffset(isTopSet || isLeftSet); //Save top-left coords as offset
12171     },
12172 
12173     /**
12174      * @private
12175      * @method _calculatePathOffset
12176      */
12177     _calculatePathOffset: function (positionSet) {
12178       return {
12179         x: positionSet ? 0 : this.left - (this.width / 2),
12180         y: positionSet ? 0 : this.top - (this.height / 2)
12181       };
12182     },
12183 
12184     /**
12185      * @private
12186      * @method _render
12187      */
12188     _render: function(ctx) {
12189       var current, // current instruction
12190           previous = null,
12191           x = 0, // current x
12192           y = 0, // current y
12193           controlX = 0, // current control point x
12194           controlY = 0, // current control point y
12195           tempX,
12196           tempY,
12197           tempControlX,
12198           tempControlY,
12199           l = -((this.width / 2) + this.pathOffset.x),
12200           t = -((this.height / 2) + this.pathOffset.y);
12201 
12202       for (var i = 0, len = this.path.length; i < len; ++i) {
12203 
12204         current = this.path[i];
12205 
12206         switch (current[0]) { // first letter
12207 
12208           case 'l': // lineto, relative
12209             x += current[1];
12210             y += current[2];
12211             ctx.lineTo(x + l, y + t);
12212             break;
12213 
12214           case 'L': // lineto, absolute
12215             x = current[1];
12216             y = current[2];
12217             ctx.lineTo(x + l, y + t);
12218             break;
12219 
12220           case 'h': // horizontal lineto, relative
12221             x += current[1];
12222             ctx.lineTo(x + l, y + t);
12223             break;
12224 
12225           case 'H': // horizontal lineto, absolute
12226             x = current[1];
12227             ctx.lineTo(x + l, y + t);
12228             break;
12229 
12230           case 'v': // vertical lineto, relative
12231             y += current[1];
12232             ctx.lineTo(x + l, y + t);
12233             break;
12234 
12235           case 'V': // verical lineto, absolute
12236             y = current[1];
12237             ctx.lineTo(x + l, y + t);
12238             break;
12239 
12240           case 'm': // moveTo, relative
12241             x += current[1];
12242             y += current[2];
12243             // draw a line if previous command was moveTo as well (otherwise, it will have no effect)
12244             ctx[(previous && (previous[0] === 'm' || previous[0] === 'M')) ? 'lineTo' : 'moveTo'](x + l, y + t);
12245             break;
12246 
12247           case 'M': // moveTo, absolute
12248             x = current[1];
12249             y = current[2];
12250             // draw a line if previous command was moveTo as well (otherwise, it will have no effect)
12251             ctx[(previous && (previous[0] === 'm' || previous[0] === 'M')) ? 'lineTo' : 'moveTo'](x + l, y + t);
12252             break;
12253 
12254           case 'c': // bezierCurveTo, relative
12255             tempX = x + current[5];
12256             tempY = y + current[6];
12257             controlX = x + current[3];
12258             controlY = y + current[4];
12259             ctx.bezierCurveTo(
12260               x + current[1] + l, // x1
12261               y + current[2] + t, // y1
12262               controlX + l, // x2
12263               controlY + t, // y2
12264               tempX + l,
12265               tempY + t
12266             );
12267             x = tempX;
12268             y = tempY;
12269             break;
12270 
12271           case 'C': // bezierCurveTo, absolute
12272             x = current[5];
12273             y = current[6];
12274             controlX = current[3];
12275             controlY = current[4];
12276             ctx.bezierCurveTo(
12277               current[1] + l,
12278               current[2] + t,
12279               controlX + l,
12280               controlY + t,
12281               x + l,
12282               y + t
12283             );
12284             break;
12285 
12286           case 's': // shorthand cubic bezierCurveTo, relative
12287 
12288             // transform to absolute x,y
12289             tempX = x + current[3];
12290             tempY = y + current[4];
12291 
12292             // calculate reflection of previous control points
12293             controlX = controlX ? (2 * x - controlX) : x;
12294             controlY = controlY ? (2 * y - controlY) : y;
12295 
12296             ctx.bezierCurveTo(
12297               controlX + l,
12298               controlY + t,
12299               x + current[1] + l,
12300               y + current[2] + t,
12301               tempX + l,
12302               tempY + t
12303             );
12304             // set control point to 2nd one of this command
12305             // "... the first control point is assumed to be the reflection of the second control point on the previous command relative to the current point."
12306             controlX = x + current[1];
12307             controlY = y + current[2];
12308 
12309             x = tempX;
12310             y = tempY;
12311             break;
12312 
12313           case 'S': // shorthand cubic bezierCurveTo, absolute
12314             tempX = current[3];
12315             tempY = current[4];
12316             // calculate reflection of previous control points
12317             controlX = 2*x - controlX;
12318             controlY = 2*y - controlY;
12319             ctx.bezierCurveTo(
12320               controlX + l,
12321               controlY + t,
12322               current[1] + l,
12323               current[2] + t,
12324               tempX + l,
12325               tempY + t
12326             );
12327             x = tempX;
12328             y = tempY;
12329 
12330             // set control point to 2nd one of this command
12331             // "... the first control point is assumed to be the reflection of the second control point on the previous command relative to the current point."
12332             controlX = current[1];
12333             controlY = current[2];
12334 
12335             break;
12336 
12337           case 'q': // quadraticCurveTo, relative
12338             // transform to absolute x,y
12339             tempX = x + current[3];
12340             tempY = y + current[4];
12341 
12342             controlX = x + current[1];
12343             controlY = y + current[2];
12344 
12345             ctx.quadraticCurveTo(
12346               controlX + l,
12347               controlY + t,
12348               tempX + l,
12349               tempY + t
12350             );
12351             x = tempX;
12352             y = tempY;
12353             break;
12354 
12355           case 'Q': // quadraticCurveTo, absolute
12356             tempX = current[3];
12357             tempY = current[4];
12358 
12359             ctx.quadraticCurveTo(
12360               current[1] + l,
12361               current[2] + t,
12362               tempX + l,
12363               tempY + t
12364             );
12365             x = tempX;
12366             y = tempY;
12367             controlX = current[1];
12368             controlY = current[2];
12369             break;
12370 
12371           case 't': // shorthand quadraticCurveTo, relative
12372 
12373             // transform to absolute x,y
12374             tempX = x + current[1];
12375             tempY = y + current[2];
12376 
12377 
12378             if (previous[0].match(/[QqTt]/) === null) {
12379               // If there is no previous command or if the previous command was not a Q, q, T or t,
12380               // assume the control point is coincident with the current point
12381               controlX = x;
12382               controlY = y;
12383             }
12384             else if (previous[0] === 't') {
12385               // calculate reflection of previous control points for t
12386               controlX = 2 * x - tempControlX;
12387               controlY = 2 * y - tempControlY;
12388             }
12389             else if (previous[0] === 'q') {
12390               // calculate reflection of previous control points for q
12391               controlX = 2 * x - controlX;
12392               controlY = 2 * y - controlY;
12393             }
12394 
12395             tempControlX = controlX;
12396             tempControlY = controlY;
12397 
12398             ctx.quadraticCurveTo(
12399               controlX + l,
12400               controlY + t,
12401               tempX + l,
12402               tempY + t
12403             );
12404             x = tempX;
12405             y = tempY;
12406             controlX = x + current[1];
12407             controlY = y + current[2];
12408             break;
12409 
12410           case 'T':
12411             tempX = current[1];
12412             tempY = current[2];
12413 
12414             // calculate reflection of previous control points
12415             controlX = 2 * x - controlX;
12416             controlY = 2 * y - controlY;
12417             ctx.quadraticCurveTo(
12418               controlX + l,
12419               controlY + t,
12420               tempX + l,
12421               tempY + t
12422             );
12423             x = tempX;
12424             y = tempY;
12425             break;
12426 
12427           case 'a':
12428             // TODO: optimize this
12429             drawArc(ctx, x + l, y + t, [
12430               current[1],
12431               current[2],
12432               current[3],
12433               current[4],
12434               current[5],
12435               current[6] + x + l,
12436               current[7] + y + t
12437             ]);
12438             x += current[6];
12439             y += current[7];
12440             break;
12441 
12442           case 'A':
12443             // TODO: optimize this
12444             drawArc(ctx, x + l, y + t, [
12445               current[1],
12446               current[2],
12447               current[3],
12448               current[4],
12449               current[5],
12450               current[6] + l,
12451               current[7] + t
12452             ]);
12453             x = current[6];
12454             y = current[7];
12455             break;
12456 
12457           case 'z':
12458           case 'Z':
12459             ctx.closePath();
12460             break;
12461         }
12462         previous = current;
12463       }
12464     },
12465 
12466     /**
12467      * Renders path on a specified context
12468      * @method render
12469      * @param {CanvasRenderingContext2D} ctx context to render path on
12470      * @param {Boolean} noTransform When true, context is not transformed
12471      */
12472     render: function(ctx, noTransform) {
12473       ctx.save();
12474       var m = this.transformMatrix;
12475       if (m) {
12476         ctx.transform(m[0], m[1], m[2], m[3], m[4], m[5]);
12477       }
12478       if (!noTransform) {
12479         this.transform(ctx);
12480       }
12481       // ctx.globalCompositeOperation = this.fillRule;
12482 
12483       if (this.overlayFill) {
12484         ctx.fillStyle = this.overlayFill;
12485       }
12486       else if (this.fill) {
12487         ctx.fillStyle = this.fill.toLiveGradient
12488           ? this.fill.toLiveGradient(ctx)
12489           : this.fill;
12490       }
12491 
12492       if (this.stroke) {
12493         ctx.strokeStyle = this.stroke;
12494       }
12495       ctx.beginPath();
12496 
12497       this._render(ctx);
12498 
12499       if (this.fill) {
12500         ctx.fill();
12501       }
12502       if (this.stroke) {
12503         ctx.strokeStyle = this.stroke;
12504         ctx.lineWidth = this.strokeWidth;
12505         ctx.lineCap = ctx.lineJoin = 'round';
12506         ctx.stroke();
12507       }
12508       if (!noTransform && this.active) {
12509         this.drawBorders(ctx);
12510         this.hideCorners || this.drawCorners(ctx);
12511       }
12512       ctx.restore();
12513     },
12514 
12515     /**
12516      * Returns string representation of an instance
12517      * @method toString
12518      * @return {String} string representation of an instance
12519      */
12520     toString: function() {
12521       return '#<fabric.Path (' + this.complexity() +
12522         '): { "top": ' + this.top + ', "left": ' + this.left + ' }>';
12523     },
12524 
12525     /**
12526      * Returns object representation of an instance
12527      * @method toObject
12528      * @param {Array} propertiesToInclude
12529      * @return {Object} object representation of an instance
12530      */
12531     toObject: function(propertiesToInclude) {
12532       var o = extend(this.callSuper('toObject', propertiesToInclude), {
12533         path: this.path
12534       });
12535       if (this.sourcePath) {
12536         o.sourcePath = this.sourcePath;
12537       }
12538       if (this.transformMatrix) {
12539         o.transformMatrix = this.transformMatrix;
12540       }
12541       return o;
12542     },
12543 
12544     /**
12545      * Returns dataless object representation of an instance
12546      * @method toDatalessObject
12547      * @param {Array} propertiesToInclude
12548      * @return {Object} object representation of an instance
12549      */
12550     toDatalessObject: function(propertiesToInclude) {
12551       var o = this.toObject(propertiesToInclude);
12552       if (this.sourcePath) {
12553         o.path = this.sourcePath;
12554       }
12555       delete o.sourcePath;
12556       return o;
12557     },
12558 
12559     /**
12560      * Returns svg representation of an instance
12561      * @method toSVG
12562      * @return {String} svg representation of an instance
12563      */
12564     toSVG: function() {
12565       var chunks = [];
12566       for (var i = 0, len = this.path.length; i < len; i++) {
12567         chunks.push(this.path[i].join(' '));
12568       }
12569       var path = chunks.join(' ');
12570 
12571       return [
12572         '<g transform="', (this.group ? '' : this.getSvgTransform()), '">',
12573           '<path ',
12574             'width="', this.width, '" height="', this.height, '" ',
12575             'd="', path, '" ',
12576             'style="', this.getSvgStyles(), '" ',
12577             'transform="translate(', (-this.width / 2), ' ', (-this.height/2), ')" />',
12578         '</g>'
12579       ].join('');
12580     },
12581 
12582     /**
12583      * Returns number representation of an instance complexity
12584      * @method complexity
12585      * @return {Number} complexity
12586      */
12587     complexity: function() {
12588       return this.path.length;
12589     },
12590 
12591     /**
12592      * @private
12593      * @method _parsePath
12594      */
12595     _parsePath: function() {
12596       var result = [ ],
12597           currentPath,
12598           chunks,
12599           parsed;
12600 
12601       for (var i = 0, chunksParsed, len = this.path.length; i < len; i++) {
12602         currentPath = this.path[i];
12603         chunks = currentPath.slice(1).trim().replace(/(\d)-/g, '$1###-').split(/\s|,|###/);
12604         chunksParsed = [ currentPath.charAt(0) ];
12605 
12606         for (var j = 0, jlen = chunks.length; j < jlen; j++) {
12607           parsed = parseFloat(chunks[j]);
12608           if (!isNaN(parsed)) {
12609             chunksParsed.push(parsed);
12610           }
12611         }
12612 
12613         var command = chunksParsed[0].toLowerCase(),
12614             commandLength = commandLengths[command];
12615 
12616         if (chunksParsed.length - 1 > commandLength) {
12617           for (var k = 1, klen = chunksParsed.length; k < klen; k += commandLength) {
12618             result.push([ chunksParsed[0] ].concat(chunksParsed.slice(k, k + commandLength)));
12619           }
12620         }
12621         else {
12622           result.push(chunksParsed);
12623         }
12624       }
12625 
12626       return result;
12627     },
12628 
12629     /**
12630      * @method _parseDimensions
12631      */
12632     _parseDimensions: function() {
12633       var aX = [],
12634           aY = [],
12635           previousX,
12636           previousY,
12637           isLowerCase = false,
12638           x,
12639           y;
12640 
12641       this.path.forEach(function(item, i) {
12642         if (item[0] !== 'H') {
12643           previousX = (i === 0) ? getX(item) : getX(this.path[i-1]);
12644         }
12645         if (item[0] !== 'V') {
12646           previousY = (i === 0) ? getY(item) : getY(this.path[i-1]);
12647         }
12648 
12649         // lowercased letter denotes relative position;
12650         // transform to absolute
12651         if (item[0] === item[0].toLowerCase()) {
12652           isLowerCase = true;
12653         }
12654 
12655         // last 2 items in an array of coordinates are the actualy x/y (except H/V);
12656         // collect them
12657 
12658         // TODO (kangax): support relative h/v commands
12659 
12660         x = isLowerCase
12661           ? previousX + getX(item)
12662           : item[0] === 'V'
12663             ? previousX
12664             : getX(item);
12665 
12666         y = isLowerCase
12667           ? previousY + getY(item)
12668           : item[0] === 'H'
12669             ? previousY
12670             : getY(item);
12671 
12672         var val = parseInt(x, 10);
12673         if (!isNaN(val)) aX.push(val);
12674 
12675         val = parseInt(y, 10);
12676         if (!isNaN(val)) aY.push(val);
12677 
12678       }, this);
12679 
12680       var minX = min(aX),
12681           minY = min(aY),
12682           maxX = max(aX),
12683           maxY = max(aY),
12684           deltaX = maxX - minX,
12685           deltaY = maxY - minY;
12686 
12687       var o = {
12688         top: minY + deltaY / 2,
12689         left: minX + deltaX / 2,
12690         bottom: max(aY) - deltaY,
12691         right: max(aX) - deltaX
12692       };
12693 
12694       o.width = deltaX;
12695       o.height = deltaY;
12696 
12697       return o;
12698     }
12699   });
12700 
12701   /**
12702    * Creates an instance of fabric.Path from an object
12703    * @static
12704    * @method fabric.Path.fromObject
12705    * @return {fabric.Path} Instance of fabric.Path
12706    */
12707   fabric.Path.fromObject = function(object) {
12708     return new fabric.Path(object.path, object);
12709   };
12710 
12711   /**
12712    * List of attribute names to account for when parsing SVG element (used by `fabric.Path.fromElement`)
12713    * @static
12714    * @see http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/paths.html#PathElement
12715    */
12716   fabric.Path.ATTRIBUTE_NAMES = 'd fill fill-opacity opacity fill-rule stroke stroke-width transform'.split(' ');
12717 
12718   /**
12719    * Creates an instance of fabric.Path from an SVG <path> element
12720    * @static
12721    * @method fabric.Path.fromElement
12722    * @param {SVGElement} element to parse
12723    * @param {Object} [options] Options object
12724    * @return {fabric.Path} Instance of fabric.Path
12725    */
12726   fabric.Path.fromElement = function(element, options) {
12727     var parsedAttributes = fabric.parseAttributes(element, fabric.Path.ATTRIBUTE_NAMES);
12728     return new fabric.Path(parsedAttributes.d, extend(parsedAttributes, options));
12729   };
12730 
12731 })(typeof exports !== 'undefined' ? exports : this);
12732 
12733 (function(global) {
12734 
12735   "use strict";
12736 
12737   var fabric = global.fabric || (global.fabric = { }),
12738       extend = fabric.util.object.extend,
12739       invoke = fabric.util.array.invoke,
12740       parentToObject = fabric.Object.prototype.toObject,
12741       camelize = fabric.util.string.camelize,
12742       capitalize = fabric.util.string.capitalize;
12743 
12744   if (fabric.PathGroup) {
12745     fabric.warn('fabric.PathGroup is already defined');
12746     return;
12747   }
12748 
12749   /**
12750    * Path group class
12751    * @class PathGroup
12752    * @extends fabric.Path
12753    */
12754   fabric.PathGroup = fabric.util.createClass(fabric.Path, /** @scope fabric.PathGroup.prototype */ {
12755 
12756     /**
12757      * Type of an object
12758      * @property
12759      * @type String
12760      */
12761     type: 'path-group',
12762 
12763     /**
12764      * Fill value
12765      * @property
12766      * @type String
12767      */
12768     fill: '',
12769 
12770     /**
12771      * Constructor
12772      * @method initialize
12773      * @param {Array} paths
12774      * @param {Object} [options] Options object
12775      * @return {fabric.PathGroup} thisArg
12776      */
12777     initialize: function(paths, options) {
12778 
12779       options = options || { };
12780       this.paths = paths || [ ];
12781 
12782       for (var i = this.paths.length; i--; ) {
12783         this.paths[i].group = this;
12784       }
12785 
12786       this.setOptions(options);
12787       this.setCoords();
12788 
12789       if (options.sourcePath) {
12790         this.setSourcePath(options.sourcePath);
12791       }
12792     },
12793 
12794     /**
12795      * Renders this group on a specified context
12796      * @method render
12797      * @param {CanvasRenderingContext2D} ctx Context to render this instance on
12798      */
12799     render: function(ctx) {
12800       ctx.save();
12801 
12802       var m = this.transformMatrix;
12803       if (m) {
12804         ctx.transform(m[0], m[1], m[2], m[3], m[4], m[5]);
12805       }
12806 
12807       this.transform(ctx);
12808       for (var i = 0, l = this.paths.length; i < l; ++i) {
12809         this.paths[i].render(ctx, true);
12810       }
12811       if (this.active) {
12812         this.drawBorders(ctx);
12813         this.hideCorners || this.drawCorners(ctx);
12814       }
12815       ctx.restore();
12816     },
12817 
12818     /**
12819      * Sets certain property to a certain value
12820      * @method _set
12821      * @param {String} prop
12822      * @param {Any} value
12823      * @return {fabric.PathGroup} thisArg
12824      */
12825     _set: function(prop, value) {
12826 
12827       if ((prop === 'fill' || prop === 'overlayFill') && value && this.isSameColor()) {
12828         var i = this.paths.length;
12829         while (i--) {
12830           this.paths[i]._set(prop, value);
12831         }
12832       }
12833 
12834       return this.callSuper('_set', prop, value);
12835     },
12836 
12837     /**
12838      * Returns object representation of this path group
12839      * @method toObject
12840      * @param {Array} [propertiesToInclude]
12841      * @return {Object} object representation of an instance
12842      */
12843     toObject: function(propertiesToInclude) {
12844       return extend(parentToObject.call(this, propertiesToInclude), {
12845         paths: invoke(this.getObjects(), 'toObject', propertiesToInclude),
12846         sourcePath: this.sourcePath
12847       });
12848     },
12849 
12850     /**
12851      * Returns dataless object representation of this path group
12852      * @method toDatalessObject
12853      * @param {Array} [propertiesToInclude]
12854      * @return {Object} dataless object representation of an instance
12855      */
12856     toDatalessObject: function(propertiesToInclude) {
12857       var o = this.toObject(propertiesToInclude);
12858       if (this.sourcePath) {
12859         o.paths = this.sourcePath;
12860       }
12861       return o;
12862     },
12863 
12864     /**
12865      * Returns svg representation of an instance
12866      * @method toSVG
12867      * @return {String} svg representation of an instance
12868      */
12869     toSVG: function() {
12870       var objects = this.getObjects();
12871       var markup = [
12872         '<g ',
12873           'width="', this.width, '" ',
12874           'height="', this.height, '" ',
12875           'style="', this.getSvgStyles(), '" ',
12876           'transform="', this.getSvgTransform(), '" ',
12877         '>'
12878       ];
12879 
12880       for (var i = 0, len = objects.length; i < len; i++) {
12881         markup.push(objects[i].toSVG());
12882       }
12883       markup.push('</g>');
12884 
12885       return markup.join('');
12886     },
12887 
12888     /**
12889      * Returns a string representation of this path group
12890      * @method toString
12891      * @return {String} string representation of an object
12892      */
12893     toString: function() {
12894       return '#<fabric.PathGroup (' + this.complexity() +
12895         '): { top: ' + this.top + ', left: ' + this.left + ' }>';
12896     },
12897 
12898     /**
12899      * Returns true if all paths in this group are of same color
12900      * @method isSameColor
12901      * @return {Boolean} true if all paths are of the same color (`fill`)
12902      */
12903     isSameColor: function() {
12904       var firstPathFill = this.getObjects()[0].get('fill');
12905       return this.getObjects().every(function(path) {
12906         return path.get('fill') === firstPathFill;
12907       });
12908     },
12909 
12910     /**
12911      * Returns number representation of object's complexity
12912      * @method complexity
12913      * @return {Number} complexity
12914      */
12915     complexity: function() {
12916       return this.paths.reduce(function(total, path) {
12917         return total + ((path && path.complexity) ? path.complexity() : 0);
12918       }, 0);
12919     },
12920 
12921     /**
12922       * Makes path group grayscale
12923       * @method toGrayscale
12924       * @return {fabric.PathGroup} thisArg
12925       */
12926     toGrayscale: function() {
12927       var i = this.paths.length;
12928       while (i--) {
12929         this.paths[i].toGrayscale();
12930       }
12931       return this;
12932     },
12933 
12934     /**
12935      * Returns all paths in this path group
12936      * @method getObjects
12937      * @return {Array} array of path objects included in this path group
12938      */
12939     getObjects: function() {
12940       return this.paths;
12941     }
12942   });
12943 
12944   /**
12945    * @private
12946    * @method instantiatePaths
12947    */
12948   function instantiatePaths(paths) {
12949     for (var i = 0, len = paths.length; i < len; i++) {
12950       if (!(paths[i] instanceof fabric.Object)) {
12951         var klassName = camelize(capitalize(paths[i].type));
12952         paths[i] = fabric[klassName].fromObject(paths[i]);
12953       }
12954     }
12955     return paths;
12956   }
12957 
12958   /**
12959    * Creates fabric.PathGroup instance from an object representation
12960    * @static
12961    * @method fabric.PathGroup.fromObject
12962    * @param {Object} object
12963    * @return {fabric.PathGroup}
12964    */
12965   fabric.PathGroup.fromObject = function(object) {
12966     var paths = instantiatePaths(object.paths);
12967     return new fabric.PathGroup(paths, object);
12968   };
12969 
12970 })(typeof exports !== 'undefined' ? exports : this);
12971 (function(global){
12972 
12973   "use strict";
12974 
12975   var fabric = global.fabric || (global.fabric = { }),
12976       extend = fabric.util.object.extend,
12977       min = fabric.util.array.min,
12978       max = fabric.util.array.max,
12979       invoke = fabric.util.array.invoke,
12980       removeFromArray = fabric.util.removeFromArray;
12981 
12982   if (fabric.Group) {
12983     return;
12984   }
12985 
12986   // lock-related properties, for use in fabric.Group#get
12987   // to enable locking behavior on group
12988   // when one of its objects has lock-related properties set
12989   var _lockProperties = {
12990     lockMovementX:  true,
12991     lockMovementY:  true,
12992     lockRotation:   true,
12993     lockScalingX:   true,
12994     lockScalingY:   true,
12995     lockUniScaling: true
12996   };
12997 
12998   /**
12999    * Group class
13000    * @class Group
13001    * @extends fabric.Object
13002    */
13003   fabric.Group = fabric.util.createClass(fabric.Object, /** @scope fabric.Group.prototype */ {
13004 
13005     /**
13006      * Type of an object
13007      * @property
13008      * @type String
13009      */
13010     type: 'group',
13011 
13012     /**
13013      * Constructor
13014      * @method initialized
13015      * @param {Object} objects Group objects
13016      * @param {Object} [options] Options object
13017      * @return {Object} thisArg
13018      */
13019     initialize: function(objects, options) {
13020       options = options || { };
13021 
13022       this.objects = objects || [];
13023       this.originalState = { };
13024 
13025       this.callSuper('initialize');
13026 
13027       this._calcBounds();
13028       this._updateObjectsCoords();
13029 
13030       if (options) {
13031         extend(this, options);
13032       }
13033       this._setOpacityIfSame();
13034 
13035       // group is active by default
13036       this.setCoords(true);
13037       this.saveCoords();
13038 
13039       //this.activateAllObjects();
13040     },
13041 
13042     /**
13043      * @private
13044      * @method _updateObjectsCoords
13045      */
13046     _updateObjectsCoords: function() {
13047       var groupDeltaX = this.left,
13048           groupDeltaY = this.top;
13049 
13050       this.forEachObject(function(object) {
13051 
13052         var objectLeft = object.get('left'),
13053             objectTop = object.get('top');
13054 
13055         object.set('originalLeft', objectLeft);
13056         object.set('originalTop', objectTop);
13057 
13058         object.set('left', objectLeft - groupDeltaX);
13059         object.set('top', objectTop - groupDeltaY);
13060 
13061         object.setCoords();
13062 
13063         // do not display corners of objects enclosed in a group
13064         object.hideCorners = true;
13065       }, this);
13066     },
13067 
13068     /**
13069      * Returns string represenation of a group
13070      * @method toString
13071      * @return {String}
13072      */
13073     toString: function() {
13074       return '#<fabric.Group: (' + this.complexity() + ')>';
13075     },
13076 
13077     /**
13078      * Returns an array of all objects in this group
13079      * @method getObjects
13080      * @return {Array} group objects
13081      */
13082     getObjects: function() {
13083       return this.objects;
13084     },
13085 
13086     /**
13087      * Adds an object to a group; Then recalculates group's dimension, position.
13088      * @method addWithUpdate
13089      * @param {Object} object
13090      * @return {fabric.Group} thisArg
13091      * @chainable
13092      */
13093     addWithUpdate: function(object) {
13094       this._restoreObjectsState();
13095       this.objects.push(object);
13096       this._calcBounds();
13097       this._updateObjectsCoords();
13098       return this;
13099     },
13100 
13101     /**
13102      * Removes an object from a group; Then recalculates group's dimension, position.
13103      * @method removeWithUpdate
13104      * @param {Object} object
13105      * @return {fabric.Group} thisArg
13106      * @chainable
13107      */
13108     removeWithUpdate: function(object) {
13109       this._restoreObjectsState();
13110       removeFromArray(this.objects, object);
13111       object.setActive(false);
13112       this._calcBounds();
13113       this._updateObjectsCoords();
13114       return this;
13115     },
13116 
13117     /**
13118      * Adds an object to a group
13119      * @method add
13120      * @param {Object} object
13121      * @return {fabric.Group} thisArg
13122      * @chainable
13123      */
13124     add: function(object) {
13125       this.objects.push(object);
13126       return this;
13127     },
13128 
13129     /**
13130      * Removes an object from a group
13131      * @method remove
13132      * @param {Object} object
13133      * @return {fabric.Group} thisArg
13134      * @chainable
13135      */
13136     remove: function(object) {
13137       removeFromArray(this.objects, object);
13138       return this;
13139     },
13140 
13141     /**
13142      * Returns a size of a group (i.e: length of an array containing its objects)
13143      * @return {Number} Group size
13144      */
13145     size: function() {
13146       return this.getObjects().length;
13147     },
13148 
13149     /**
13150      * Properties that are delegated to group objects when reading/writing
13151      */
13152     delegatedProperties: {
13153       fill:             true,
13154       opacity:          true,
13155       fontFamily:       true,
13156       fontWeight:       true,
13157       lineHeight:       true,
13158       textDecoration:   true,
13159       textShadow:       true,
13160       backgroundColor:  true
13161     },
13162 
13163     /**
13164      * @private
13165      */
13166     _set: function(key, value) {
13167       if (key in this.delegatedProperties) {
13168         var i = this.objects.length;
13169         this[key] = value;
13170         while (i--) {
13171           this.objects[i].set(key, value);
13172         }
13173       }
13174       else {
13175         this[key] = value;
13176       }
13177     },
13178 
13179     /**
13180      * Returns true if a group contains an object
13181      * @method contains
13182      * @param {Object} object Object to check against
13183      * @return {Boolean} `true` if group contains an object
13184      */
13185     contains: function(object) {
13186       return this.objects.indexOf(object) > -1;
13187     },
13188 
13189     /**
13190      * Returns object representation of an instance
13191      * @method toObject
13192      * @param {Array} propertiesToInclude
13193      * @return {Object} object representation of an instance
13194      */
13195     toObject: function(propertiesToInclude) {
13196       return extend(this.callSuper('toObject', propertiesToInclude), {
13197         objects: invoke(this.objects, 'toObject', propertiesToInclude)
13198       });
13199     },
13200 
13201     /**
13202      * Renders instance on a given context
13203      * @method render
13204      * @param {CanvasRenderingContext2D} ctx context to render instance on
13205      */
13206     render: function(ctx, noTransform) {
13207       ctx.save();
13208       this.transform(ctx);
13209 
13210       var groupScaleFactor = Math.max(this.scaleX, this.scaleY);
13211 
13212       //The array is now sorted in order of highest first, so start from end.
13213       for (var i = this.objects.length; i > 0; i--) {
13214 
13215         var object = this.objects[i-1],
13216             originalScaleFactor = object.borderScaleFactor,
13217             originalHasRotatingPoint = object.hasRotatingPoint;
13218 
13219         object.borderScaleFactor = groupScaleFactor;
13220         object.hasRotatingPoint = false;
13221 
13222         object.render(ctx);
13223 
13224         object.borderScaleFactor = originalScaleFactor;
13225         object.hasRotatingPoint = originalHasRotatingPoint;
13226       }
13227 
13228       if (!noTransform && this.active) {
13229         this.drawBorders(ctx);
13230         this.hideCorners || this.drawCorners(ctx);
13231       }
13232       ctx.restore();
13233       this.setCoords();
13234     },
13235 
13236     /**
13237      * Returns object from the group at the specified index
13238      * @method item
13239      * @param index {Number} index of item to get
13240      * @return {fabric.Object}
13241      */
13242     item: function(index) {
13243       return this.getObjects()[index];
13244     },
13245 
13246     /**
13247      * Returns complexity of an instance
13248      * @method complexity
13249      * @return {Number} complexity
13250      */
13251     complexity: function() {
13252       return this.getObjects().reduce(function(total, object) {
13253         total += (typeof object.complexity === 'function') ? object.complexity() : 0;
13254         return total;
13255       }, 0);
13256     },
13257 
13258     /**
13259      * Retores original state of each of group objects (original state is that which was before group was created).
13260      * @private
13261      * @method _restoreObjectsState
13262      * @return {fabric.Group} thisArg
13263      * @chainable
13264      */
13265     _restoreObjectsState: function() {
13266       this.objects.forEach(this._restoreObjectState, this);
13267       return this;
13268     },
13269 
13270     /**
13271      * Restores original state of a specified object in group
13272      * @private
13273      * @method _restoreObjectState
13274      * @param {fabric.Object} object
13275      * @return {fabric.Group} thisArg
13276      */
13277     _restoreObjectState: function(object) {
13278 
13279       var groupLeft = this.get('left'),
13280           groupTop = this.get('top'),
13281           groupAngle = this.getAngle() * (Math.PI / 180),
13282           rotatedTop = Math.cos(groupAngle) * object.get('top') + Math.sin(groupAngle) * object.get('left'),
13283           rotatedLeft = -Math.sin(groupAngle) * object.get('top') + Math.cos(groupAngle) * object.get('left');
13284 
13285       object.setAngle(object.getAngle() + this.getAngle());
13286 
13287       object.set('left', groupLeft + rotatedLeft * this.get('scaleX'));
13288       object.set('top', groupTop + rotatedTop * this.get('scaleY'));
13289 
13290       object.set('scaleX', object.get('scaleX') * this.get('scaleX'));
13291       object.set('scaleY', object.get('scaleY') * this.get('scaleY'));
13292 
13293       object.setCoords();
13294       object.hideCorners = false;
13295       object.setActive(false);
13296       object.setCoords();
13297 
13298       return this;
13299     },
13300 
13301     /**
13302      * Destroys a group (restoring state of its objects)
13303      * @method destroy
13304      * @return {fabric.Group} thisArg
13305      * @chainable
13306      */
13307     destroy: function() {
13308       return this._restoreObjectsState();
13309     },
13310 
13311     /**
13312      * Saves coordinates of this instance (to be used together with `hasMoved`)
13313      * @saveCoords
13314      * @return {fabric.Group} thisArg
13315      * @chainable
13316      */
13317     saveCoords: function() {
13318       this._originalLeft = this.get('left');
13319       this._originalTop = this.get('top');
13320       return this;
13321     },
13322 
13323     /**
13324      * Checks whether this group was moved (since `saveCoords` was called last)
13325      * @method hasMoved
13326      * @return {Boolean} true if an object was moved (since fabric.Group#saveCoords was called)
13327      */
13328     hasMoved: function() {
13329       return this._originalLeft !== this.get('left') ||
13330              this._originalTop !== this.get('top');
13331     },
13332 
13333     /**
13334      * Sets coordinates of all group objects
13335      * @method setObjectsCoords
13336      * @return {fabric.Group} thisArg
13337      * @chainable
13338      */
13339     setObjectsCoords: function() {
13340       this.forEachObject(function(object) {
13341         object.setCoords();
13342       });
13343       return this;
13344     },
13345 
13346     /**
13347      * Activates (makes active) all group objects
13348      * @method activateAllObjects
13349      * @return {fabric.Group} thisArg
13350      * @chainable
13351      */
13352     activateAllObjects: function() {
13353       this.forEachObject(function(object) {
13354         object.setActive();
13355       });
13356       return this;
13357     },
13358 
13359     /**
13360      * Executes given function for each object in this group
13361      * @method forEachObject
13362      * @param {Function} callback
13363      *                   Callback invoked with current object as first argument,
13364      *                   index - as second and an array of all objects - as third.
13365      *                   Iteration happens in reverse order (for performance reasons).
13366      *                   Callback is invoked in a context of Global Object (e.g. `window`)
13367      *                   when no `context` argument is given
13368      *
13369      * @param {Object} context Context (aka thisObject)
13370      *
13371      * @return {fabric.Group} thisArg
13372      * @chainable
13373      */
13374     forEachObject: fabric.StaticCanvas.prototype.forEachObject,
13375 
13376     /**
13377      * @private
13378      * @method _setOpacityIfSame
13379      */
13380     _setOpacityIfSame: function() {
13381       var objects = this.getObjects(),
13382           firstValue = objects[0] ? objects[0].get('opacity') : 1;
13383 
13384       var isSameOpacity = objects.every(function(o) {
13385         return o.get('opacity') === firstValue;
13386       });
13387 
13388       if (isSameOpacity) {
13389         this.opacity = firstValue;
13390       }
13391     },
13392 
13393     /**
13394      * @private
13395      * @method _calcBounds
13396      */
13397     _calcBounds: function() {
13398       var aX = [],
13399           aY = [],
13400           minX, minY, maxX, maxY, o, width, height,
13401           i = 0,
13402           len = this.objects.length;
13403 
13404       for (; i < len; ++i) {
13405         o = this.objects[i];
13406         o.setCoords();
13407         for (var prop in o.oCoords) {
13408           aX.push(o.oCoords[prop].x);
13409           aY.push(o.oCoords[prop].y);
13410         }
13411       }
13412 
13413       minX = min(aX);
13414       maxX = max(aX);
13415       minY = min(aY);
13416       maxY = max(aY);
13417 
13418       width = (maxX - minX) || 0;
13419       height = (maxY - minY) || 0;
13420 
13421       this.width = width;
13422       this.height = height;
13423 
13424       this.left = (minX + width / 2) || 0;
13425       this.top = (minY + height / 2) || 0;
13426     },
13427 
13428     /**
13429      * Checks if point is contained within the group
13430      * @method containsPoint
13431      * @param {fabric.Point} point point with `x` and `y` properties
13432      * @return {Boolean} true if point is contained within group
13433      */
13434     containsPoint: function(point) {
13435 
13436       var halfWidth = this.get('width') / 2,
13437           halfHeight = this.get('height') / 2,
13438           centerX = this.get('left'),
13439           centerY = this.get('top');
13440 
13441       return  centerX - halfWidth < point.x &&
13442               centerX + halfWidth > point.x &&
13443               centerY - halfHeight < point.y &&
13444               centerY + halfHeight > point.y;
13445     },
13446 
13447     /**
13448      * Makes all of this group's objects grayscale (i.e. calling `toGrayscale` on them)
13449      * @method toGrayscale
13450      * @return {fabric.Group} thisArg
13451      * @chainable
13452      */
13453     toGrayscale: function() {
13454       var i = this.objects.length;
13455       while (i--) {
13456         this.objects[i].toGrayscale();
13457       }
13458       return this;
13459     },
13460 
13461     /**
13462      * Returns svg representation of an instance
13463      * @method toSVG
13464      * @return {String} svg representation of an instance
13465      */
13466     toSVG: function() {
13467       var objectsMarkup = [ ];
13468       for (var i = 0, len = this.objects.length; i < len; i++) {
13469         objectsMarkup.push(this.objects[i].toSVG());
13470       }
13471 
13472       return (
13473         '<g transform="' + this.getSvgTransform() + '">' +
13474           objectsMarkup.join('') +
13475         '</g>');
13476     },
13477 
13478     /**
13479      * Returns requested property
13480      * @method get
13481      * @param {String} prop Property to get
13482      * @return {Any}
13483      */
13484     get: function(prop) {
13485       if (prop in _lockProperties) {
13486         if (this[prop]) {
13487           return this[prop];
13488         }
13489         else {
13490           for (var i = 0, len = this.objects.length; i < len; i++) {
13491             if (this.objects[i][prop]) {
13492               return true;
13493             }
13494           }
13495           return false;
13496         }
13497       }
13498       else {
13499         return this[prop];
13500       }
13501     }
13502   });
13503 
13504   /**
13505    * Returns {@link fabric.Group} instance from an object representation
13506    * @static
13507    * @method fabric.Group.fromObject
13508    * @param {Object} object Object to create a group from
13509    * @param {Object} [options] Options object
13510    * @return {fabric.Group} An instance of fabric.Group
13511    */
13512   fabric.Group.fromObject = function(object, callback) {
13513     fabric.util.enlivenObjects(object.objects, function(enlivenedObjects) {
13514       delete object.objects;
13515       callback && callback(new fabric.Group(enlivenedObjects, object));
13516     });
13517   };
13518 
13519   /**
13520    * Indicates that instances of this type are async
13521    * @static
13522    * @type Boolean
13523    */
13524   fabric.Group.async = true;
13525 
13526 })(typeof exports !== 'undefined' ? exports : this);
13527 (function(global) {
13528 
13529   "use strict";
13530 
13531   var extend = fabric.util.object.extend;
13532 
13533   if (!global.fabric) {
13534     global.fabric = { };
13535   }
13536 
13537   if (global.fabric.Image) {
13538     fabric.warn('fabric.Image is already defined.');
13539     return;
13540   }
13541 
13542   /**
13543    * Image class
13544    * @class Image
13545    * @extends fabric.Object
13546    */
13547   fabric.Image = fabric.util.createClass(fabric.Object, /** @scope fabric.Image.prototype */ {
13548 
13549     /**
13550      * Type of an object
13551      * @property
13552      * @type String
13553      */
13554     type: 'image',
13555 
13556     /**
13557      * Constructor
13558      * @param {HTMLImageElement | String} element Image element
13559      * @param {Object} [options] Options object
13560      * @return {fabric.Image}
13561      */
13562     initialize: function(element, options) {
13563       options || (options = { });
13564 
13565       this.callSuper('initialize', options);
13566       this._initElement(element);
13567       this._originalImage = this.getElement();
13568       this._initConfig(options);
13569 
13570       this.filters = [ ];
13571 
13572       if (options.filters) {
13573         this.filters = options.filters;
13574         this.applyFilters();
13575       }
13576     },
13577 
13578     /**
13579      * Returns image element which this instance if based on
13580      * @method getElement
13581      * @return {HTMLImageElement} image element
13582      */
13583     getElement: function() {
13584       return this._element;
13585     },
13586 
13587     /**
13588      * Sets image element for this instance to a specified one
13589      * @method setElement
13590      * @param {HTMLImageElement} element
13591      * @return {fabric.Image} thisArg
13592      * @chainable
13593      */
13594     setElement: function(element) {
13595       this._element = element;
13596       this._initConfig();
13597       return this;
13598     },
13599 
13600     /**
13601      * Returns original size of an image
13602      * @method getOriginalSize
13603      * @return {Object} object with "width" and "height" properties
13604      */
13605     getOriginalSize: function() {
13606       var element = this.getElement();
13607       return {
13608         width: element.width,
13609         height: element.height
13610       };
13611     },
13612 
13613     /**
13614      * Renders image on a specified context
13615      * @method render
13616      * @param {CanvasRenderingContext2D} ctx Context to render on
13617      */
13618     render: function(ctx, noTransform) {
13619       ctx.save();
13620       var m = this.transformMatrix;
13621       this._resetWidthHeight();
13622       if (this.group) {
13623         ctx.translate(-this.group.width/2 + this.width/2, -this.group.height/2 + this.height/2);
13624       }
13625       if (m) {
13626         ctx.transform(m[0], m[1], m[2], m[3], m[4], m[5]);
13627       }
13628       if (!noTransform) {
13629         this.transform(ctx);
13630       }
13631       this._render(ctx);
13632       if (this.active && !noTransform) {
13633         this.drawBorders(ctx);
13634         this.hideCorners || this.drawCorners(ctx);
13635       }
13636       ctx.restore();
13637     },
13638 
13639     /**
13640      * Returns object representation of an instance
13641      * @method toObject
13642      * @param {Array} propertiesToInclude
13643      * @return {Object} object representation of an instance
13644      */
13645     toObject: function(propertiesToInclude) {
13646       return extend(this.callSuper('toObject', propertiesToInclude), {
13647         src: this._originalImage.src || this._originalImage._src,
13648         filters: this.filters.concat()
13649       });
13650     },
13651 
13652     /**
13653      * Returns SVG representation of an instance
13654      * @method toSVG
13655      * @return {String} svg representation of an instance
13656      */
13657     toSVG: function() {
13658       return '<g transform="' + this.getSvgTransform() + '">'+
13659                 '<image xlink:href="' + this.getSvgSrc() + '" '+
13660                   'style="' + this.getSvgStyles() + '" ' +
13661                   // we're essentially moving origin of transformation from top/left corner to the center of the shape
13662                   // by wrapping it in container <g> element with actual transformation, then offsetting object to the top/left
13663                   // so that object's center aligns with container's left/top
13664                   'transform="translate('+ (-this.width/2) + ' ' + (-this.height/2) + ')" ' +
13665                   'width="' + this.width + '" ' +
13666                   'height="' + this.height + '"' + '></image>' +
13667               '</g>';
13668     },
13669 
13670     /**
13671      * Returns source of an image
13672      * @method getSrc
13673      * @return {String} Source of an image
13674      */
13675     getSrc: function() {
13676       return this.getElement().src || this.getElement()._src;
13677     },
13678 
13679     /**
13680      * Returns string representation of an instance
13681      * @method toString
13682      * @return {String} String representation of an instance
13683      */
13684     toString: function() {
13685       return '#<fabric.Image: { src: "' + this.getSrc() + '" }>';
13686     },
13687 
13688     /**
13689      * Returns a clone of an instance
13690      * @method clone
13691      * @param {Array} propertiesToInclude
13692      * @param {Function} callback Callback is invoked with a clone as a first argument
13693      */
13694     clone: function(callback, propertiesToInclude) {
13695       this.constructor.fromObject(this.toObject(propertiesToInclude), callback);
13696     },
13697 
13698     /**
13699      * Applies filters assigned to this image (from "filters" array)
13700      * @mthod applyFilters
13701      * @param {Function} callback Callback is invoked when all filters have been applied and new image is generated
13702      * @return {fabric.Image} thisArg
13703      * @chainable
13704      */
13705     applyFilters: function(callback) {
13706 
13707       if (this.filters.length === 0) {
13708         this.setElement(this._originalImage);
13709         callback && callback();
13710         return;
13711       }
13712 
13713       var isLikelyNode = typeof Buffer !== 'undefined' && typeof window === 'undefined',
13714           imgEl = this._originalImage,
13715           canvasEl = fabric.document.createElement('canvas'),
13716           replacement = isLikelyNode ? new (require('canvas').Image)() : fabric.document.createElement('img'),
13717           _this = this;
13718 
13719         if (!canvasEl.getContext && typeof G_vmlCanvasManager !== 'undefined') {
13720           G_vmlCanvasManager.initElement(canvasEl);
13721         }
13722 
13723       canvasEl.width = imgEl.width;
13724       canvasEl.height = imgEl.height;
13725 
13726       canvasEl.getContext('2d').drawImage(imgEl, 0, 0, imgEl.width, imgEl.height);
13727 
13728       this.filters.forEach(function(filter) {
13729         filter && filter.applyTo(canvasEl);
13730       });
13731 
13732        /** @ignore */
13733       replacement.onload = function() {
13734         _this._element = replacement;
13735         callback && callback();
13736         replacement.onload = canvasEl = imgEl = null;
13737       };
13738       replacement.width = imgEl.width;
13739       replacement.height = imgEl.height;
13740 
13741       if (isLikelyNode) {
13742         var base64str = canvasEl.toDataURL('image/png').replace(/data:image\/png;base64,/, '');
13743         replacement.src = new Buffer(base64str, 'base64');
13744         _this._element = replacement;
13745 
13746         // onload doesn't fire in node, so we invoke callback manually
13747         callback && callback();
13748       }
13749       else {
13750         replacement.src = canvasEl.toDataURL('image/png');
13751       }
13752 
13753       return this;
13754     },
13755 
13756     /**
13757      * @private
13758      * @method _render
13759      * @param ctx
13760      */
13761     _render: function(ctx) {
13762       ctx.drawImage(
13763         this.getElement(),
13764         - this.width / 2,
13765         -this.height / 2,
13766         this.width,
13767         this.height
13768       );
13769     },
13770 
13771     /**
13772      * @private
13773      * @method _resetWidthHeight
13774      */
13775     _resetWidthHeight: function() {
13776       var element = this.getElement();
13777 
13778       this.set('width', element.width);
13779       this.set('height', element.height);
13780     },
13781 
13782     /**
13783      * The Image class's initialization method. This method is automatically
13784      * called by the constructor.
13785      * @private
13786      * @method _initElement
13787      * @param {HTMLImageElement|String} el The element representing the image
13788      */
13789     _initElement: function(element) {
13790       this.setElement(fabric.util.getById(element));
13791       fabric.util.addClass(this.getElement(), fabric.Image.CSS_CANVAS);
13792     },
13793 
13794     /**
13795      * @private
13796      * @method _initConfig
13797      * @param {Object} [options] Options object
13798      */
13799     _initConfig: function(options) {
13800       options || (options = { });
13801       this.setOptions(options);
13802       this._setWidthHeight(options);
13803     },
13804 
13805     /**
13806      * @private
13807      * @method _initFilters
13808      * @param {Object} object Object with filters property
13809      */
13810     _initFilters: function(object) {
13811       if (object.filters && object.filters.length) {
13812         this.filters = object.filters.map(function(filterObj) {
13813           return filterObj && fabric.Image.filters[filterObj.type].fromObject(filterObj);
13814         });
13815       }
13816     },
13817 
13818     /**
13819      * @private
13820      * @method _setWidthHeight
13821      * @param {Object} [options] Object with width/height properties
13822      */
13823     _setWidthHeight: function(options) {
13824       this.width = 'width' in options
13825         ? options.width
13826         : (this.getElement().width || 0);
13827 
13828       this.height = 'height' in options
13829         ? options.height
13830         : (this.getElement().height || 0);
13831     },
13832 
13833     /**
13834      * Returns complexity of an instance
13835      * @method complexity
13836      * @return {Number} complexity
13837      */
13838     complexity: function() {
13839       return 1;
13840     }
13841   });
13842 
13843   /**
13844    * Default CSS class name for canvas
13845    * @static
13846    * @type String
13847    */
13848   fabric.Image.CSS_CANVAS = "canvas-img";
13849 
13850   /**
13851    * Alias for getSrc
13852    * @static
13853    * @method getSvgSrc
13854    */
13855   fabric.Image.prototype.getSvgSrc = fabric.Image.prototype.getSrc;
13856 
13857   /**
13858    * Creates an instance of fabric.Image from its object representation
13859    * @static
13860    * @method fromObject
13861    * @param {Object} object
13862    * @param {Function} [callback] Callback to invoke when an image instance is created
13863    */
13864   fabric.Image.fromObject = function(object, callback) {
13865     var img = fabric.document.createElement('img'),
13866         src = object.src;
13867 
13868     if (object.width) {
13869       img.width = object.width;
13870     }
13871     if (object.height) {
13872       img.height = object.height;
13873     }
13874 
13875     /** @ignore */
13876     img.onload = function() {
13877       fabric.Image.prototype._initFilters.call(object, object);
13878 
13879       var instance = new fabric.Image(img, object);
13880       callback && callback(instance);
13881       img = img.onload = null;
13882     };
13883     img.src = src;
13884   };
13885 
13886   /**
13887    * Creates an instance of fabric.Image from an URL string
13888    * @static
13889    * @method fromURL
13890    * @param {String} url URL to create an image from
13891    * @param {Function} [callback] Callback to invoke when image is created (newly created image is passed as a first argument)
13892    * @param {Object} [imgOptions] Options object
13893    */
13894   fabric.Image.fromURL = function(url, callback, imgOptions) {
13895     var img = fabric.document.createElement('img');
13896 
13897     /** @ignore */
13898     img.onload = function() {
13899       if (callback) {
13900         callback(new fabric.Image(img, imgOptions));
13901       }
13902       img = img.onload = null;
13903     };
13904     img.src = url;
13905   };
13906 
13907   /**
13908    * List of attribute names to account for when parsing SVG element (used by {@link fabric.Image.fromElement})
13909    * @static
13910    * @see http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/struct.html#ImageElement
13911    */
13912   fabric.Image.ATTRIBUTE_NAMES = 'x y width height fill fill-opacity opacity stroke stroke-width transform xlink:href'.split(' ');
13913 
13914   /**
13915    * Returns {@link fabric.Image} instance from an SVG element
13916    * @static
13917    * @method fabric.Image.fromElement
13918    * @param {SVGElement} element Element to parse
13919    * @param {Function} callback Callback to execute when fabric.Image object is created
13920    * @param {Object} [options] Options object
13921    * @return {fabric.Image}
13922    */
13923   fabric.Image.fromElement = function(element, callback, options) {
13924     options || (options = { });
13925 
13926     var parsedAttributes = fabric.parseAttributes(element, fabric.Image.ATTRIBUTE_NAMES);
13927 
13928     fabric.Image.fromURL(parsedAttributes['xlink:href'], callback, extend(parsedAttributes, options));
13929   };
13930 
13931   /**
13932    * Indicates that instances of this type are async
13933    * @static
13934    * @type Boolean
13935    */
13936   fabric.Image.async = true;
13937 
13938 })(typeof exports !== 'undefined' ? exports : this);
13939 
13940 fabric.util.object.extend(fabric.Object.prototype, {
13941 
13942   /**
13943    * @private
13944    * @method _getAngleValueForStraighten
13945    * @return {Number} angle value
13946    */
13947   _getAngleValueForStraighten: function() {
13948     var angle = this.getAngle() % 360;
13949     if (angle > 0) {
13950       return Math.round((angle-1)/90) * 90;
13951     }
13952     return Math.round(angle/90) * 90;
13953   },
13954 
13955   /**
13956    * Straightens an object (rotating it from current angle to one of 0, 90, 180, 270, etc. depending on which is closer)
13957    * @method straighten
13958    * @return {fabric.Object} thisArg
13959    * @chainable
13960    */
13961   straighten: function() {
13962     this.setAngle(this._getAngleValueForStraighten());
13963     return this;
13964   },
13965 
13966   /**
13967    * Same as {@link fabric.Object.prototype.straghten} but with animation
13968    * @method fxStraighten
13969    * @param {Object} callbacks
13970    *                  - onComplete: invoked on completion
13971    *                  - onChange: invoked on every step of animation
13972    *
13973    * @return {fabric.Object} thisArg
13974    * @chainable
13975    */
13976   fxStraighten: function(callbacks) {
13977     callbacks = callbacks || { };
13978 
13979     var empty = function() { },
13980         onComplete = callbacks.onComplete || empty,
13981         onChange = callbacks.onChange || empty,
13982         _this = this;
13983 
13984     fabric.util.animate({
13985       startValue: this.get('angle'),
13986       endValue: this._getAngleValueForStraighten(),
13987       duration: this.FX_DURATION,
13988       onChange: function(value) {
13989         _this.setAngle(value);
13990         onChange();
13991       },
13992       onComplete: function() {
13993         _this.setCoords();
13994         onComplete();
13995       },
13996       onStart: function() {
13997         _this.setActive(false);
13998       }
13999     });
14000 
14001     return this;
14002   }
14003 });
14004 
14005 fabric.util.object.extend(fabric.StaticCanvas.prototype, {
14006 
14007   /**
14008    * Straightens object, then rerenders canvas
14009    * @method straightenObject
14010    * @param {fabric.Object} object Object to straighten
14011    * @return {fabric.Canvas} thisArg
14012    * @chainable
14013    */
14014   straightenObject: function (object) {
14015     object.straighten();
14016     this.renderAll();
14017     return this;
14018   },
14019 
14020   /**
14021    * Same as {@link fabric.Canvas.prototype.straightenObject}, but animated
14022    * @method fxStraightenObject
14023    * @param {fabric.Object} object Object to straighten
14024    * @return {fabric.Canvas} thisArg
14025    * @chainable
14026    */
14027   fxStraightenObject: function (object) {
14028     object.fxStraighten({
14029       onChange: this.renderAll.bind(this)
14030     });
14031     return this;
14032   }
14033 });
14034 /**
14035  * @namespace
14036  */
14037 fabric.Image.filters = { };
14038 
14039 /**
14040  * Grayscale image filter class
14041  * @class fabric.Image.filters.Grayscale
14042  * @memberOf fabric.Image.filters
14043  */
14044 fabric.Image.filters.Grayscale = fabric.util.createClass( /** @scope fabric.Image.filters.Grayscale.prototype */ {
14045 
14046   /**
14047    * Filter type
14048    * @param {String} type
14049    */
14050   type: "Grayscale",
14051 
14052   /**
14053    * Applies filter to canvas element
14054    * @method applyTo
14055    * @memberOf fabric.Image.filters.Grayscale.prototype
14056    * @param {Object} canvasEl Canvas element to apply filter to
14057    */
14058   applyTo: function(canvasEl) {
14059     var context = canvasEl.getContext('2d'),
14060         imageData = context.getImageData(0, 0, canvasEl.width, canvasEl.height),
14061         data = imageData.data,
14062         iLen = imageData.width,
14063         jLen = imageData.height,
14064         index, average, i, j;
14065 
14066      for (i = 0; i < iLen; i++) {
14067        for (j = 0; j < jLen; j++) {
14068 
14069          index = (i * 4) * jLen + (j * 4);
14070          average = (data[index] + data[index + 1] + data[index + 2]) / 3;
14071 
14072          data[index]     = average;
14073          data[index + 1] = average;
14074          data[index + 2] = average;
14075        }
14076      }
14077 
14078      context.putImageData(imageData, 0, 0);
14079   },
14080 
14081   /**
14082    * Returns json representation of filter
14083    * @method toJSON
14084    * @return {String} json representation of filter
14085    */
14086   toJSON: function() {
14087     return { type: this.type };
14088   }
14089 });
14090 
14091 /**
14092  * Returns filter instance from an object representation
14093  * @static
14094  * @method fabric.Image.filters.Grayscale.fromObject
14095  * @return {fabric.Image.filters.Grayscale}
14096  */
14097 fabric.Image.filters.Grayscale.fromObject = function() {
14098   return new fabric.Image.filters.Grayscale();
14099 };
14100 
14101 /**
14102  * Remove white filter class
14103  * @class fabric.Image.filters.RemoveWhite
14104  * @memberOf fabric.Image.filters
14105  */
14106 fabric.Image.filters.RemoveWhite = fabric.util.createClass( /** @scope fabric.Image.filters.RemoveWhite.prototype */ {
14107 
14108   /**
14109    * Filter type
14110    * @param {String} type
14111    */
14112   type: "RemoveWhite",
14113 
14114   /**
14115    * Constructor
14116    * @memberOf fabric.Image.filters.RemoveWhite.prototype
14117    * @param {Object} [options] Options object
14118    */
14119   initialize: function(options) {
14120     options || (options = { });
14121     this.threshold = options.threshold || 30;
14122     this.distance = options.distance || 20;
14123   },
14124 
14125   /**
14126    * Applies filter to canvas element
14127    * @method applyTo
14128    * @param {Object} canvasEl Canvas element to apply filter to
14129    */
14130   applyTo: function(canvasEl) {
14131     var context = canvasEl.getContext('2d'),
14132         imageData = context.getImageData(0, 0, canvasEl.width, canvasEl.height),
14133         data = imageData.data,
14134         threshold = this.threshold,
14135         distance = this.distance,
14136         limit = 255 - threshold,
14137         abs = Math.abs,
14138         r, g, b;
14139 
14140     for (var i = 0, len = data.length; i < len; i += 4) {
14141 
14142       r = data[i];
14143       g = data[i+1];
14144       b = data[i+2];
14145 
14146       if (r > limit &&
14147           g > limit &&
14148           b > limit &&
14149           abs(r-g) < distance &&
14150           abs(r-b) < distance &&
14151           abs(g-b) < distance) {
14152 
14153         data[i+3] = 1;
14154       }
14155     }
14156 
14157     context.putImageData(imageData, 0, 0);
14158   },
14159 
14160   /**
14161    * Returns json representation of filter
14162    * @method toJSON
14163    * @return {String} json representation of filter
14164    */
14165   toJSON: function() {
14166     return {
14167       type: this.type,
14168       threshold: this.threshold,
14169       distance: this.distance
14170     };
14171   }
14172 });
14173 
14174 /**
14175  * Returns filter instance from an object representation
14176  * @static
14177  * @method fabric.Image.filters.RemoveWhite.fromObject
14178  * @return {fabric.Image.filters.RemoveWhite}
14179  */
14180 fabric.Image.filters.RemoveWhite.fromObject = function(object) {
14181   return new fabric.Image.filters.RemoveWhite(object);
14182 };
14183 
14184 /**
14185  * Invert filter class
14186  * @class fabric.Image.filters.Invert
14187  * @memberOf fabric.Image.filters
14188  */
14189 fabric.Image.filters.Invert = fabric.util.createClass( /** @scope fabric.Image.filters.Invert.prototype */ {
14190 
14191   /**
14192    * Filter type
14193    * @param {String} type
14194    */
14195   type: "Invert",
14196 
14197   /**
14198    * Applies filter to canvas element
14199    * @method applyTo
14200    * @memberOf fabric.Image.filters.Invert.prototype
14201    * @param {Object} canvasEl Canvas element to apply filter to
14202    */
14203   applyTo: function(canvasEl) {
14204     var context = canvasEl.getContext('2d'),
14205         imageData = context.getImageData(0, 0, canvasEl.width, canvasEl.height),
14206         data = imageData.data,
14207         iLen = data.length, i;
14208 
14209      for (i = 0; i < iLen; i+=4) {
14210         data[i] = 255 - data[i];
14211         data[i + 1] = 255 - data[i + 1];
14212         data[i + 2] = 255 - data[i + 2];
14213      }
14214 
14215      context.putImageData(imageData, 0, 0);
14216   },
14217 
14218   /**
14219    * Returns json representation of filter
14220    * @method toJSON
14221    * @return {String} json representation of filter
14222    */
14223   toJSON: function() {
14224     return { type: this.type };
14225   }
14226 });
14227 
14228 /**
14229  * Returns filter instance from an object representation
14230  * @static
14231  * @method fabric.Image.filters.Invert.fromObject
14232  * @return {fabric.Image.filters.Invert}
14233  */
14234 fabric.Image.filters.Invert.fromObject = function() {
14235   return new fabric.Image.filters.Invert();
14236 };
14237 
14238 /**
14239  * Sepia filter class
14240  * @class fabric.Image.filters.Sepia
14241  * @memberOf fabric.Image.filters
14242  */
14243 fabric.Image.filters.Sepia = fabric.util.createClass( /** @scope fabric.Image.filters.Sepia.prototype */ {
14244 
14245   /**
14246    * Filter type
14247    * @param {String} type
14248    */
14249   type: "Sepia",
14250 
14251   /**
14252    * Applies filter to canvas element
14253    * @method applyTo
